programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Writer Jimmy McGovern discusses his latest series Broken, and Sean Fletcher discusses living without social media.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Charles Hanson and Charlie Ross guide the red and blue teams around the Ardingly Antiques and collectors fair, where presenter Tim Wonnacott spots a rare pair of silver salt cellars.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a large semi-detached property in Rotherham, South Yorkshire, a former chapel in Fraddon, Cornwall and a small terraced house in Putney, south-west London. They then speak to the owners about their plans for the buildings and find out how much they paid for them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore prevents a post-war table, a used suitcase and an old radio from being dumped at the tip in Stockport, and sets about transforming them in the hope they can be sold.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin heads to rural Lincolnshire to help two canal boat enthusiasts find a home to suit their lives on dry land. Away from the house hunt, he helps power up one of the county's iconic windmills.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Brook family from Nottingham lower their food bills, and show them ways to follow a healthier diet while saving money on their weekly shop. Daughters Rosie and Sophia prefer snacking on sugary treats than following a healthy, balanced diet, and their fussy eating habits mean Mum Janine is forced to cook separate meals for the family each night.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones visits Chatsworth House for its first ever flower show, and Pam Rhodes learns about the estate's royal history. With hymns from St John the Baptist's Church in Tideswell.(n)

programme.title: Sue Barker: Our Wimbledon
programme.desc: The presenter travels the globe meeting Wimbledon greats such as Andy Murray, Roger Federer, Pete Sampras, Billie Jean King and Martina Navratilova.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison meets a family making natural cordials and presses using their own elderflowers, before visiting Worcester Cathedral to catch a glimpse of its lesser horseshoe bats, thought to be the only urban population in the country. Adam Henson heads to the Peak District and explains why he has decided to send his beef cattle to an animal sanctuary in Norfolk rather than the slaughterhouse.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce introduces a selection of unscreened items from recent shows. Among the fascinating finds are a garnet and diamond cross believed by the owner to have been gifted by Marie Antoinette en route to the guillotine, and a suitcase of unopened letters from an imprisoned First World War soldier that finally reveal their secrets. Plus, an arts-and-crafts casket once intended to be the final resting place of a woman's ashes.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: A grain ship is raided by starving villagers, and George arranges a harsh punishment for the desperate peasants while throwing a lavish Christmas party to impress the local gentry. Caroline hears news that the Admiralty has arranged for the release of the British officers, but Ross is not convinced, lamenting the loss of Wheal Leisure to George, and having seen miners broken by the terms of their labour. Demelza gives birth to a daughter, and warns Morwenna against a relationship with Drake.(n)

programme.title: The Week the Landlords Moved In
programme.desc: A transformative series challenging some of Britain's most successful landlords to spend an eye-opening week living in one of their own rental properties. In the first episode, Essex-based landlords Marc and Peter are faced with some uncomfortable truths about the state of some of their rental properties, and self-made millionaire Paul experiences what it is like living in shared accommodation.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Michelle Ackerley reports from a fire station in the West Midlands to see how the emergency services deal with cannabis farms, while Rav Wilding talks to a victim of ransomware.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin visits a Leicestershire cottage, Martin Roberts is at a south London property auction, and Lucy Alexander meets two friends who have bought a bungalow in Kent.(n)

programme.title: Kitchen Garden Live with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: New series. Si King and Dave Myers are at RHS Hampton Court Palace Flower Show to encourage viewers to grow their own produce. With celebrity guests, chefs and gardening experts.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A burglar takes too long when trying to steal from a laptop repair shop and a ski centre is repeatedly robbed by a sweet-toothed thief, whose trainer prints catch him out.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help the red and blue teams find bargains at the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh, while host Anita Manning explores the city's castle.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents the latest from day one at the All England Club, with all eyes on defending men's champion Andy Murray as he begins his campaign on Centre Court against Alexander Bublik. Murray claimed his second Wimbledon crown here last year with a straight-sets victory over Milos Raonic, and starts the championships as world number one. A positive run to the semi-finals of the French Open has helped to turn Murray's season around following a slow start, and the Scot will face threats from the likes of Novak Djokovic, Stan Wawrinka and the rejuvenated veterans Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal. Other matches taking place today in the men's draw include Wawrinka v Daniil Medvedev, and Nadal v John Millman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Bus Wars
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the fierce competition between big bus tour companies in Belfast as they fight for a share of the lucrative tourist market. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Karen finds Bernadette playing truant from school, and refuses to believe her daughter's claims of being unwell. Abi tries to worm her way into Steven's affections, forcing him to remind her that what happened between them was a one-off, while Robbie struggles to establish himself with the market traders. New nanny Ingrid starts looking after Ricky and Amy, and Fi continues to make her mark on the Vic.(n)

programme.title: The Betrayed Girls
programme.desc: In May 2012, eight British-Pakistani men and an Afghan asylum-seeker were found guilty of the grooming, rape and sex trafficking of underage teenage girls in Rochdale, but it turned out that police and social services had known about the abusers for years and that the scandal went far beyond the Greater Manchester town. This feature-length documentary features testimonies from victims whose stories have not been told before and includes interviews with people who spoke out on behalf of the girls.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his career, recalling his first appearance on Irish television and discussing a school reunion. There's trouble down at the Phoenix Club when Stars in Your Eyes gets cancelled, while Elton John makes a guest appearance.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You.
programme.desc: Extended edition. Comedian, writer and actress Katherine Ryan guest hosts the satirical quiz, with stand-up Joe Wilkinson and broadcaster and writer Gyles Brandreth joining regular team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to poke fun at the week's news.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Danny Clarke head to Croydon to create exotic, Jamaican-style garden for owner Carmen, who needs a tranquil space to remember her lost daughter. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame joins Monty Don at Longmeadow to add more medicinal planting to the herb garden - especially those that bees love. She also investigates how gardeners can aid honey bee conservation and protect the nation's favourite pollinators. Monty visits a garden in Herefordshire to see a collection of Siberian Iris, which inspires him to create a new Iris patch, adding warmth and splash of colour into his dry garden. The green-fingered experts also discover a garden containing a stunning collection of clematis Montana. Plus, Nick Bailey reveals how to plan, design and build a border fit for any garden, while in Somerset, Carol Klein visits the home of Margery Fish, the writer who exercised a strong influence on the informal style of the cottage garden, before her death in 1969.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Jim McColl investigates the mysterious death of a hedge and suspects foul play, and meets a couple who have created a high-up hidden gem of a garden in Ballinluig. Carole Baxter pays a second visit to Ardersier to see how Mari Reid and friends are getting on Vegetable Gardening on a Budget.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher reports from Carmarthenshire, where he meets an expert on birds of prey in Carmarthenshire who uses drones designed to look like birds to train falcons to hunt. He takes a look behind the scenes in the workshop where they are built and visits a breeding unit for peregrine falcon chicks. Plus, a selection of reports from the series featuring working animals.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt revisits highlights from throughout the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: A look back at last year's tournament at the All England Club, which saw Andy Murray and Serena Williams crowned as men's and ladies' singles champions.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.sub-title: Athletics: Diamond League Highlights: 2017 Meeting de Paris.
programme.desc: The Meeting de Paris. Gabby Logan introduces action from the seventh meeting of the season, which took place at Stade de France.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of day two from Alexander Stadium in Birmingham, where Britain's best athletes will try to qualify for the IAAF World Championships in Athletics, which is due to take place at The Olympic Stadium in London next Month. With commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Paula Radcliffe and Andrew Cotter, and analysis from Colin Jackson, Denise Lewis and Toni Minichiello.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.sub-title: Inside the Factory: How Our Favourite Foods Are Made: Milk.
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a milk-processing plant to see how they get the liquid from cow to carton in less than 24 hours, and Cherry Healey finds out how milk is used to make cheese and ice-cream on an epic scale. She also reveals why many people in the world actually can't drink the white stuff, and historian Ruth Goodman explores the tough life of a dairy maid.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.sub-title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway: The Final Countdown..
programme.desc: Part one of two. Return of the documentary about the construction of the Crossrail train line linking east and west London, following those racing to complete the work in time for the first trains to run in May. Engineer Linda Miller and her team must battle ancient fault lines that threaten the Farringdon station site with flooding, while construction workers build innovative floating rail tracks directly under the Barbican Concert Hall. Julian Barratt narrates.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Even Davis presents the business ideas contest, with Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sarah Willingham and Nick Jenkins casting an eye over more money-spinning ideas. Projects up for investment this week include an unusual coffee lid, a range of coconut-based products, and a safety device for hairstyling gadgets.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: Daredevil Tennessee cowboy Blane and fun-loving Welsh office worker William trade places in an effort to find a new perspective on their lives. Both men are in their 20s and find themselves in a very similar predicament - they are about to take over the reins of their lucrative family businesses and must decide whether they want to commit to a path worked out for them, or follow their hearts and forge their own careers.(n)

programme.title: George Best: All By Himself
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the reserved young football prodigy from Belfast who became a global superstar, but whose career was blighted by his battle with the pressures of fame. The film reveals how the player dubbed El Beatle helped Manchester United to win two league titles and the European Cup, but his extravagant lifestyle led to various problems, most notably alcoholism.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Nish Kumar and Romesh Ranganathan. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: Vincent's life takes a turn for the worse as he finds himself kicked out of his family home and in debt to the Inland Revenue to the tune of £50,000. Meanwhile, Lavender, having his own career crisis, is drawn back to the world of rock and roll, and invites Sam along to a gig.(n)

programme.title: Burke & Hare
programme.desc: Two Irishmen in 19th-century Edinburgh have to dispose of a dead lodger, and learn a doctor pays well for cadavers to use in his anatomy lectures. Seeing a chance to get rich, they soon progress from grave robbing to murder in a bid to keep their benefactor in fresh corpses. Comedy horror, starring Simon Pegg, Andy Serkis, Tom Wilkinson and Jessica Hynes.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Hastings, East Sussex, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jac buries herself in work, determined to save the life of a scared and fatalistic patient, while Sacha is forced to confront his faith when his mother sets him up on a blind date. Donna Jackson returns to Holby City, but clashes with Fletch's authority and questions whether too much has changed for her to simply pick up where she left off.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Former Blue Peter presenter and intrepid adventurer Helen Skelton joins Brian Conley for a trip down memory lane, revisiting the classic archive TV that helped shape her into the person she now is. Clips include excerpts of Newsround, the early antics of Geordie duo Ant and Dec, the extreme challenges of The Krypton Factor and children's favourite Pingu.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the show's experts look back over some of the lucky finds at car boot sales and charity shops that have proved a good investment, including an exquisite Italian necklace that had been hidden away for years.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Leominster in Herefordshire, where experts Caroline Hawley and Thomas Plant advise two teams competing to win the greater profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the Lake District. Items brought in to be valued include a rare collection of signed Beatrix Potter first editions belonging to descendants of the author's solicitor, a desk that belonged to the last Russian tsar which was bought following the revolution, some Edwardian weightlifting equipment and a set of over 100 vintage firefighters' helmets.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces live coverage of the opening day's play at the All England Club, as this year's championships get under way in the men's and ladies' singles. The third Grand Slam event of the year on the hallowed grass courts is always one of the highlights of the sporting calendar, and the seeded players may be at risk of upsets as they acclimatise to the conditions after playing on clay for so long, although there were relatively few shocks on the opening day last year. Matches in the bottom half of the ladies draw are scheduled to take place today, including Johanna Konta v Hsieh Su-wei, Dominika Cibulkova v Andrea Petkovic, and Laura Robson v Beatriz Haddad Maia, while second seed Simona Halep is due to face a qualifier. The commentary team includes a number of previous winners, including Pat Cash, Boris Becker, John McEnroe, Martina Navratilova and Billie Jean King.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the opening day's play at the All England Club, where the first round got under way in the men's and ladies' singles. Much of the attention will have been on the opening match on Centre Court, which saw Andy Murray begin the defence of his title, as he aims to triumph for a third time at SW19. The bottom half of the women's draw also started, with the draw wide open in the absence of defending champion Serena Williams, who has won the title for the last two years.(n)

programme.title: Ripper Street
programme.desc: Serial killer Nathaniel Dove goes into hiding deep in Hackney Marshes, where his brother Augustus intends to keep him safe until Reid's capture and incarceration have been secured. But can the assistant commissioner rely on his brother to stay out of trouble? Meanwhile, Reid is left to stew in the cavernous backstage of the Alexandria Theatre with Long Susan, Jackson and Mimi, and with so much history between the four of them, tensions begin to mount. Matthew Macfadyen and Adam Rothenberg star.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Sudan: The Last of the Rhinos.
programme.desc: The remarkable story of Sudan, the very last male northern white rhino on the planet. Snatched from his mother's side in Central Africa, Sudan became a prized exhibit in a zoo while the rest of his kind were poached to near-extinction. This programme focuses on the desperate battle to bring his sub-species back from the brink of extinction, told through the characters who have been involved in his life.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: Documentary about traditional Japanese craftspeople, beginning by following Shiro Kunimitsu and his family as they craft a katana of exceptional sharpness and durability, continuing a tradition begun by their ancestors nearly three centuries ago.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: The production of the traditional garment, following the painstaking process of the silk being bound, hand-dyed, woven and finally turned into a kimono by a seamstress.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: A look at the work of the Hamadas, one of Japan's most famous families of potters, following Tomoo as he creates and fires pots in a wood-fuelled kiln.(n)

programme.title: Schonbrunn Summer Night Concert from Vienna
programme.desc: Katie Derham introduces the open-air concert from the gardens of the Schoenbrunn Palace in Vienna, given by the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Christoph Eschenbach.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary exploring humans' relationship with pigs, looking at such things as the xenotransplantation of organs and wild hogs being hunted with machine guns from a helicopter.(n)

programme.title: Climate Change by Numbers
programme.desc: The debate surrounding climate change, as the public appears to be less sure it understands exactly what is going on, despite there being more information on the issue than ever. Mathematicians Dr Hannah Fry, Professor Norman Fenton and Professor David Spiegelhalter discuss the three key numbers that clarify the important questions around climate change, as scientists use them to help explain what is happening to the Earth.(n)

programme.title: Darwin's Struggle: The Evolution of the Origin of Species
programme.desc: Notes and correspondence, film extracts and interviews with biographers and scientists provide an insight into the struggle Charles Darwin went through while working on his book On the Origin of Species. This documentary reveals how he suffered family tragedies, physical illness and moments of self-doubt during the writing process.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: The migration of elephant herds across Botswana's Kalahari Desert during the annual flooding of the Okavango Delta, which turns 4,000 square miles of arid plains into a maze of wetlands, setting the scene for great clashes between animals in search of water. Resourceful elephants make the most of stagnant pools and waterholes guarded by lions, while hippos converge on prime territories to do battle. David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Boxing at the Movies: Kings of the Ring
programme.desc: Writer and critic Danny Leigh explores the elemental drama of the boxing movie, examining how each generation's fight films have reflected their times and been used to address powerful themes such as redemption, race and corruption. He asks why film-makers from Stanley Kubrick to Martin Scorsese have depicted tales of the ring, and interviews former undisputed world heavyweight champion Lennox Lewis, Rocky director John G Avildsen and Thelma Schoonmaker, editor of Raging Bull.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins in the ruinous gardens at Aberglasney House near Llandeilo before riding shotgun in the driver's cab on one of the most scenic routes in Britain. Over the border in Leominster, Herefordshire, he steps out onto the dance floor at the Lion Hotel Ballroom, where a grand ball was held to celebrate the opening of the Ludlow to Hereford railway, and finishes this leg of his journey at a traditional cider house in Hereford.(n)

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Dr Helen Czerski examines the complexities of colour, including what it is, how it works, and how it has written the story of the planet. In the first edition, she looks for the colours that have made the earth multi-coloured, investigating the essence of sunlight, how vivid blue is formed from sulphur atoms, and why the presence of red ochre is a key sign of life. She also looks at why gold should not even exist on the surface of the planet, and the role of salt and water in shaping planet earth.(n)

programme.title: Science and Islam
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili travels to Iran, Syria, Egypt, Tunisia, Spain, and Italy to chart the scientific achievements that occurred in the Islamic world between the eighth and 14th centuries. The nuclear physicist examines the development of algebra by the mathematician Al-Khwarizmi, improvements made to medical diagnosis by Al-Razi and the regular scholarly debates organised by the ruling elite in Baghdad in the eighth and ninth centuries.(n)

programme.title: The Hidden Art of Islam
programme.desc: Rageh Omaar visits an exhibition of artefacts from the Muslim world at the British Museum, and examines artworks reflecting Hajj, the holy pilgrimage to Mecca. He discovers how Islamic artists throughout history have reacted to laws governing depictions of human figures and religious rituals, and explores the culture's tradition of figurative art.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Waves
programme.desc: David Malone investigates the importance of ocean waves. He discovers they are not made of water, can travel sideways and their sound is created by bubbles, and examines the connection between the life cycles of waves and human beings.(n)

programme.title: World Rally Championship
programme.desc: Rally Poland, round eight of the season, continues with SS11 as drivers tackle a 15.55km route through Baranowo. Andreas Mikkelsen was the victor here last year.(n)

programme.title: World Rally Championship
programme.desc: Rally Poland, round eight of the season, continues with SS15 as drivers tackle the 15.55km route for a second time. Andreas Mikkelsen was the victor here last year.(n)

programme.title: Live World Rally Championship
programme.desc: Rally Poland, round eight of the season, continues with SS21 as drivers tackle a 18.68km route through Paprotki. Andreas Mikkelsen was the victor here last year.(n)

programme.title: World Rally Championship
programme.desc: This documentary offers a fascinating behind the scenes look at the return of Toyota to the FIA World Rally Championship after an 18-year absence.(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1981, a pudgy 19-year-old Mexican pitcher, Fernando Valenzuela, took the MLB by storm, shattering America's image of the ace pitcher. Part of the award-winning 30 for 30 series.(n)

programme.title: Live Rowing: Henley Royal Regatta
programme.desc: Day five of the historic Henley Royal Regatta, one of the most famed sporting and social occasions in the world. James Cracknell and Sir Matthew Pinsent provide expert analysis.(n)

programme.title: NBA Action
programme.desc: Action is the watchword for this fast paced highlights programme, which rounds up the latest action from the NBA.(n)

programme.title: Premier League World
programme.desc: This Premier League World special sits down with Welshman Craig Bellamy, as he charts the ups and downs of his career, which was never lacking in drama and controversy.(n)

programme.title: I Believe in Miracles
programme.desc: This documentary tells the real-life story of Nottingham Forest's extraordinary 1979 European Cup triumph and the colourful exploits of the club's manager, Brian Clough.(n)

programme.title: WTA Tennis
programme.desc: The biggest WTA stars glam up and step out for the WTA Pre-Wimbledon Party in London.(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30 Shorts
programme.desc: This 30 for 30 Shorts documentary reveals how Arnold Schwarzenegger's mandatory military service in the Austrian Army played a critical role in his journey to international fame.(n)

programme.title: Live Brasileirao
programme.desc: Flamengo and Sao Paulo clash in the Brazilian League at the Estadio Luso Brasileiro.(n)

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Valentino Rossi continues his remarkable title charge at round nine at the Sachsenring. The veteran, who won his 115th GP at Assen, is seven points behind leader Andrea Dovizioso.(n)

programme.title: MotoGP Chequered Flag
programme.desc: Craig Doyle is joined by Neil Hodgson and James Toseland to review all the action from the Grand Prix of Germany. Featuring analysis and interviews with all the key riders.(n)

programme.title: Live NBA
programme.desc: A look at the NBA stars who are available as free agents.(n)

programme.title: World Rally Championship
programme.desc: Highlights from day three of Rally Poland, round eight of the year. The day's action featured the four final tests, including the new Paprotki Power Stage.(n)

programme.title: World Sailing
programme.desc: The latest action and news from the world of sailing.(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The University of Miami's American football team rose from the ashes to win another national championship, only to face new controversies. Part of the acclaimed 30 for 30 series.(n)

programme.title: AFL

programme.desc: Real-time business and stock-market news broadcast from the New York Stock Exchange begins at the opening bell, and also features reports from the CME Group in Chicago as well as coverage of the closing bells in Europe(n)

programme.title: Squawk Alley

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 422. The Sharks are presented with a fishing bobber made from a real shotgun shell; a cupcakes-in-a-jar business; an idea for turning each step a person takes into usable electricity; and a belt with no holes. Also: an update on Billy Blanks Jr. and his Dance With Me fitness program, which Mark and Daymond invested in during Season 3(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 722. A former business analyst presents the Sharks with an idea for an adults-only sleepaway camp, with the promise of s'more fun; and a 15-year-old entrepreneur claims to have created better equipment for her favorite sport(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 611. Three sisters make a pitch for their dating app; an entrepreneur claims to have a solution to a common problem for online shoppers; a former publisher shares her design for a shirt that makes people look skinny; and a pair of Wall Street brokers demonstrate a compact way to eat a bagel. Also: an update on Hamboards, which Robert invested in during Season 5(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 610. The Sharks celebrate 100 episodes with a look back at their favorite memories, plus they reveal why they participate on the show, as well as take part in a cake-cutting ceremony and a champagne toast. Also: a mother and son who are concerned with healthy bowels; a plywood alternative for storm protection; organic mini-popcorn created by siblings from Brooklyn; a dairy-free line of plant-based cheeses; and an update on the Living Christmas Company invested in by Mark Cuban during Season 5(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 713. Entrepreneurs pitch their ideas for a heavy-equipment adventure company; and a protein-filled pancake mix. Also: A Secret Service agent from Woodbridge, Va., has a solution for men who want to keep their ties looking sharp; and there's an update on Cousins Maine Lobster, which Barbara invested in during Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 206. An entrepreneur hawks a secret formula; a stay-at-home mom builds furniture; and a personal trainer pitches a fitness device. Also: children share an idea with the sharks that they came up with while on a family road trip(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 311. Pitches include a flavored mix-and-match lip-balm kissing enhancer, a line of kitchen products, a heat-recycling device and a clothing item that the guy pitching it says is "revolutionary." He calls Apple cofounder Steve Wozniak for advice. Also: a follow-up on a South Carolina woman's Season 2 homemade Daisy Cakes(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 603. Two men try to sell the Sharks on their stuffed animals for the bathtub; a dog lover from Los Angeles shows off a wearable pet carrier; and ninja entrepreneurs demonstrate a darts-like card game. Also: a follow-up on a custom bike company based in Dallas, which was invested in by Mark and Barbara during Season 3(n)

programme.title: American Greed
programme.desc: Kevin Trudeau's Secrets; Remington Steal. The case of Kevin Trudeau, an infomercial pitchman who claimed he was broke and could not pay a $37.6 million fine imposed by the Federal Trade Commission, is chronicled. Also: an examination of Remington Financial Group's advanced-fee scam that defrauded investors in small businesses and real-estate ventures(n)

Disaster movie, starring Pierce Brosnan, Linda Hamilton, Elizabeth Hoffman and Charles Hallahan.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows software executive Andy and garden designer Nicki, who are planning to build a `floating' house on the Thames, which would be the first of its kind in the UK. Their architect has come up with an ambitious, experimental design that would see the whole property magically rise up with the flood waters. However, no one knows whether it will work, and the project soon becomes bogged down in the logistical challenges of bringing to fruition such a complex structure on a small island that is only accessible by a narrow footbridge.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Documentary examining the famous Second World War evacuation of Allied soldiers - codenamed Operation Dynamo - from the beaches of Dunkirk, France, between May 26 and June 4, 1940. Recently released Ministry of Defence files reveal that, far from being absent as many historians have believed, the RAF was suffering massive losses supporting the evacuation. Operating at high altitude and deep inside France, RAF planes were halting the bulk of Luftwaffe bombers before they could reach the beaches. The files also reveal that the famous Spitfire took flight for the first time during the mission, and the agile fighter was a spectacular success.(n)

programme.title: The Handmaid's Tale
programme.desc: When a trade delegation from Mexico comes to Gilead, Offred discovers several shocking secrets. Serena Joy reflects on her marriage and the role she played in Gilead's inception. Drama based on the novel by Margaret Atwood and set in the dystopia of Gilead, a totalitarian society in what was formerly part of the United States. Starring Elisabeth Moss and Yvonne Strahovski.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: Trance
programme.desc: An art dealer becomes involved in a plot to steal a valuable painting from his own auction house, but a blow to the head causes him to develop amnesia. Unable to remember the stolen item's whereabouts, he starts seeing a hypnotist to recall where he left it, but as she searches the depths of his mind, the barriers between fiction and reality begin to blur. Danny Boyle's non-linear crime thriller, starring James McAvoy and Rosario Dawson.(n)

programme.title: The Vow
programme.desc: A newlywed couple are involved in a car accident, and the wife wakes up with no memory of her husband. While he tries to get her to fall in love with him all over again, she is reunited with her estranged parents, who never approved of the marriage and see her condition as a chance to make a fresh start. Romantic drama, with Rachel McAdams, Channing Tatum, Jessica Lange and Sam Neill.(n)

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi heads to Ramsbottom in Greater Manchester to lend her expertise to Charlotte Belcher, who has been running the 14-bedroom Grant Arms Hotel for two and a half years. Despite its attractive, central location, the 19th-century listed venue has developed a bad reputation as a hang-out for a `rough crowd' - particularly at the bar. With no profits to pay for renovations, Charlotte has enlisted her husband and two children to help turn the Grant Arms around, but her work-life balance is starting to tip drastically away from home, and the beleaguered hotelier hopes Alex will find a way to boost the hotel's income while also restoring her private life.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: Engineer Rob Bell offers an insight into the history, design and building process of the Britannia Bridge, across the Menai Strait between the island of Anglesey and the mainland of Wales. The difficult task of building the 100ft iron structure was taken up by civil engineer Robert Stephenson and his team, including William Fairbairn and Eaton Hodgkinson. But in May 1970, four youths set light to the famous bridge, and Rob meets a fireman who fought the blaze that fateful night.(n)

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow examines the life and legacy of German painter Albrecht Durer, who set a new benchmark in self-portraiture and raised the artistic reputation of northern Europe to a level rivaling that of Renaissance Italy. Like his contemporary Leonardo da Vinci, Durer perceived the world with a scientist's eye, and his detailed studies of plants and animals remain unrivalled to this day.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The hero must save Norman and James, who get stuck up a tree while trying to rescue their model airplane.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Gordon gets jealous and causes a nasty accident on the track.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Leah, Shimmer and Shine meet a mermaid and explore her underwater world.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of Smartysaurus's Rainbow Experiment.
programme.desc: When Smartysaurus' latest experiment sees her attempt to make a rainbow, something goes wrong and Noddy needs to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder and the Paw Patrol need to fix the lighthouse so they can save Cap'n Turbot, who is stuck in thick fog.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle goes angling with Mr Elf, Ben and Holly, and decides they should catch mean fish Big Bad Barry for their supper.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: Animation following the adventures of a dragon and his best friends. Digby feels down on Dragon Day as he cannot yet fly or breathe fire.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The playgroup puts on a play and Peppa gets to be Little Red Riding Hood.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Bert the polar bear has made friends with the arctic fox and Barry Bear feels left out, so Wissper calls on Monty the meerkat to help make amends.(n)

programme.title: Wanda and the Alien
programme.desc: The duo go gardening with Wanda's mother, and find a worm called Jim.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Journalist and broadcaster Matthew Wright is joined by a panel of guests and the studio audience to debate the issues of the day.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Tracy Metro meets couple Peter and Sharon, who have spent four years trying to sell their property in Southport, Merseyside, and need advice on brightening up the decor.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Roo is rushed to hospital after Nate and Tori find her in excruciating pain, Justin blames Lena for Brody's drug problem and VJ struggles with Luc's custody arrangements.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Mark and Paige's secret is revealed, Leo's guest makes a move on Elly, while Terese prepares to tell Gary the news about her cancer.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A rocket engine expert is killed, leaving Eric to go undercover to ensure that classified technology remains secure. The rest of the team catches up with the dead man's business partner, as well as his daughter - who suspects murder and even provides a name. Chris O'Donnell and Barrett Foa star.(n)

programme.title: Stalking Elizabeth
programme.desc: After the death of her daughter, a woman tries to regain a sense of normality by returning to teaching. However, she is assigned a mentor who develops an unsettling obsession for her. Drama, starring Jes Macallan, Aaron Douglas and Nic Bishop. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Mark and Paige's secret is revealed, Leo's guest makes a move on Elly, while Terese prepares to tell Gary the news about her cancer.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Roo is rushed to hospital after Nate and Tori find her in excruciating pain, Justin blames Lena for Brody's drug problem and VJ struggles with Luc's custody arrangements.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: MotoGP Highlights
programme.desc: The Grand Prix of Germany. Action from the ninth round of the season, which was held at the Sachsenring near Chemnitz. Spanish rider Marc Marquez won last year's race on the notoriously difficult circuit, closely followed by Britain's Cal Crutchlow and Italian Andrea Dovizioso in second and third respectively.(n)

programme.title: All New Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The return after a break of the documentary following the work of officers from police forces across Yorkshire. Officers crack down on uninsured drivers whose recklessness raises everyone's premiums and kills more than 130 road users every year. In Halifax, a high-speed pursuit after one of these criminals ends in a devastating collision and foot race, while in Leeds a van courier is stopped, fails to deliver the correct paperwork to the cops, and then fails a drug test. Jamie Theakston presents.(n)

programme.title: Eamonn & Ruth: How the Other Half Lives
programme.desc: Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford return to explore the extravagant lifestyles of the super-rich, beginning by heading to the largest city in the United Arab Emirates. After experiencing a luxury night under the stars in the desert, they visit the Burj Khalifa - the tallest building in the world - to meet a multimillionaire who calls it home.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the live Big Brother companion show, including a debate on the burning issues and celebrity guests' thoughts on the latest developments.(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A thief enlists the help of mythical Egyptian gods to overthrow a vicious ruler(n)

programme.title: Chernobyl Diaries
programme.desc: An extreme vacation turns terrifying when a group of friends visit the Chernobyl disaster site, and learn that some nightmares never die. Conceived and produced by Paranormal Activity's Oren Peli, Chernobyl Diaries gets underway as six thrill-seeking tourists hire a fearless tour guide, and travel to the abandoned Ukrainian city of Pripyat. Back when the Chernobyl nuclear reactor was up and running, Pripyat was the place the workers called home. But 25 years after one of the worst power-plant accidents in history, the city serves as an eerily silent testament to the dangers of nuclear power. Later, after getting unexpectedly stranded in Pripyat, the tourists and their guide realize they are being hunted. Now the harder they try to flee, the faster their numbers dwindle until only a few are left standing. Only then will the unspeakable terror that stalks these deserted streets finally emerge from the shadows to launch one last relentless, terrifying attack(n)

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: Jimmy Popeye Doyle and his partner, Buddy Russo, are New York City police detectives on narcotics detail, trying to track down the source of heroin from Europe into the United States(n)

programme.title: Pride and Glory
programme.desc: Gavin O'Connor's New York-set police corruption thriller starring Edward Norton, Colin Farrell and Jon Voight. When four cops are shot dead in a drugs bust gone bad, detective Ray Tierney is persuaded by his father, NYPD chief Francis Sr, to lead the investigation into what went wrong. But as Ray delves further, it becomes ever more apparent that the corruption he uncovers no only threatens scandal for the Washington Heights precinct, but is also likely to rip apart his own family, most of whom are also in the force(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of professional climbers successfully scale Mount Everest only to be faced with tragedy when a monster storm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent. Jake Gyllenhaal, Josh Brolin, Jason Clarke, and John Hawkes co-star. Directed by Baltasar Kormakur (2 Guns)(n)

programme.title: The Vanishing
programme.desc: Dutch filmmaker George Sluizer's award-winning psychological suspense thriller with Gene Bervoets whose agonizing three-year search for the kidnapper of his girlfriend Joanna Ter Steege brings him chillingly and dangerously into contact with psychotic Bernard-pierre Donnadieu(n)

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: While treasure hunting in the Bahamas, a group of young divers discover a wrecked cargo plane on the ocean's floor. Within lies millions of dollars of illegal drugs, and the divers' dream of finding sunken treasure has come true. But as they argue among themselves about what to do with their prize, the friends soon realize they're not the only ones interested in the narcotics. Dangerous criminals are also searching for the drugs, and now the treasure hunters themselves have become the hunted(n)

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Conor O'Neill is usually one step ahead of the loan sharks. But this time, his debts force him to accept a job coaching tough Chicago kids. Conor plans to take the money and run, but when the team starts looking up to him, he realises he'll have to take responsibility for the first time in his life(n)

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Biopic of Ernie Davis, who overcame prejudice to become the first black athlete to win the highest honour in college football(n)

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Sports biopic of Michael "Eddie the Eagle" Edwards (Taron Egerton), whose participation in the 1988 Winter Olympics at Calgary marked the first time a Brit had ever competed in the ski-jumping event. Edwards trains as a ski jumper under the tutelage of a hard-drinking former champ (Hugh Jackman), and eventually finds fame as a lovable loser who's just trying his best. Directed by Dexter Fletcher(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Based on the life of legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens, who became the greatest track and field athlete in history at the world stage of the 1936 Olympics by winning four gold medals. He achieved this amazing feat under the gaze of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: Play It to the Bone
programme.desc: Boxing comedy drama about two ageing fighters who never made the big time but remain good friends. When an undercard bout in Las Vegas is cancelled at short notice, they are asked to step in. Unfortunately, they have to fight each other(n)

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: An EPA marshal (Steven Seagal) goes undercover in a mining community to investigate the murder of a friend. He joins forces with two locals, and they embark on a quest to stop a treacherous corporation that has been illegally dumping toxic waste. Marg Helgenberger, Harry Dean Stanton, Stephen Lang(n)

programme.title: Tetro
programme.desc: On the heels of the self-financed, modestly budgeted 2007 drama Youth Without Youth -- his first directorial outing after a ten-year hiatus -- filmmaker Francis Ford Coppola remains situated in the director's chair for this semi-autobiographical family drama concerning an artistic family of immigrants whose fierce rivalries span several generations. Vincent Gallo stars with newcomer Alden Ehrenreich, with Carmen Maura, Maribel Verdú, and Alden Ehrenreich rounding out the cast(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Wall Street Banker Jack Campbell has it all: more cash than he can shake a stick at, oodles of power and, above all, his freedom. But on Christmas Eve he challenges an armed robber, then on Christmas Day he wakes up to the life he would have had if he'd stayed with his college girlfriend: two noisy kids, a dead-end job selling tyres, and a people carrier instead of his Ferrari. At first he's horrified..(n)

programme.title: WarGames
programme.desc: John Badham's thriller about a high-schooler whose home computer gains access to the US missile-warning system(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate consultant must determine the fate of a mysterious artificial being called Morgan, which has begun evolving at a faster rate than anticipated in this tense sci-fi thriller. When Morgan attacks one of her creators, the group surrounding her are pressed to make a decision(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: Robert Zemeckis's comedy-adventure stars Kathleen Turner as reclusive best-selling writer Joan Wilder. When Joan receives a message from her sister saying she's been kidnapped in Colombia, she heads south to help her. Ending up stranded in the middle of nowhere, she bumps into adventurer Jack T Colton, who offers to help her. The two become involved in a search not only for her sister but also for a fabulous precious jewel. Hindering them are inept villains Ralph and Ira and a local bandit chief who happens to be Joan's number one fan..(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In this brutal survival tale based on a true story, 19th-century frontiersman Hugh Glass is betrayed and left for dead by his fur-trapping party after he is viciously attacked by a grizzly bear. However, Glass survives and sets out to seek revenge(n)

programme.title: 12 Rounds
programme.desc: Cop Danny Fisher must complete 12 dangerous challenges, devised by the criminal mastermind who has kidnapped his girlfriend(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Based on a novel by Elleston Trevor, director John Moore's The Flight of the Phoenix is a remake of a 1965 film of the same name starring film icon James Stewart. The story revolves around the plight of Captain Frank Towns (Dennis Quaid), a pilot whose C-119 cargo plane full of oil workers could not withstand the violent winds of a desert sandstorm. Stranded in the harsh terrain of Mongolia's Gobi Desert (a departure from the original, in which the plane crashed in the Sahara), Frank and his navigator face an equal challenge in maintaining order among the survivors. The group of oilmen had planned on an uneventful trip to shut off a group of rigs falling below their productivity expectations -- not fending for their very lives. Before long, some men are revealed as cowards, while others exhibit a surprising show of strength, all the while hoping that the wreckage of the original plane can be salvaged before a Lord of the Flies situation occurs. Miranda Otto is featured in a supporting role, as well as Giovanni Ribisi and Tyrese Gibson(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: 'On any given Sunday you're gonna win or you're gonna lose. The point is - can you win or lose like a man?' Macho stuff from director Oliver Stone , with a cast of heavyweights from both cinema and pro sport(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate consultant must determine the fate of a mysterious artificial being called Morgan, which has begun evolving at a faster rate than anticipated in this tense sci-fi thriller. When Morgan attacks one of her creators, the group surrounding her are pressed to make a decision(n)

programme.title: The Forest
programme.desc: Set in the Aokigahara Forest, which is a place where people commit suicides, a young American woman, Sara, is in search of her twin sister, who has mysteriously disappeared in the forest. Despite the warnings from the villagers, Sara travels into the ghost-filled forest to save her sister to discover the truth while being confronted by angry and tormented souls of the dead that prey on anyone who crosses their paths(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: Blockbuster sequel with Bruce Willis reprising his role as maverick cop John McClane. This time, McClane must pull out all the stops to save New York from a crazed bomber(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: When internet terrorists try to bring the US to its knees by shutting down every major computer system, NYPD detective John McClane makes a stand. All-out action sequel(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A thief enlists the help of mythical Egyptian gods to overthrow a vicious ruler(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Medicinal Fried Chicken. Cartman is furious to find that his favourite restaurant has been turned into a medical marijuana dispensary. Randy is less disappointed(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: More Crap. Somewhat inadvertently, Randy breaks the world record for the 'biggest crap'! Bono, the previous holder, is determined to regain his crown. But he has a dark secret which may stop him(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: It Hits the Fan. No one wants to go to the stage version of 'The Lion King' with Kyle. The rest of the boys would rather watch TV(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Naughty Ninjas. A game of Ninja Warriors is led by Kenny and attracts attention from foreign terrorists. Meanwhile, the citizens of South Park decide they don't need a police department anymore(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The Passion of the Jew. "The Passion of the Christ" has an unusual effect on Stan, Cartman, Kyle and Kenny(n)

programme.title: Inside Amy Schumer
programme.desc: Down for Whatever. Amy screams at a turtle; objects to a wedding; and breaks up with her boyfriend(n)

programme.title: Inside Amy Schumer
programme.desc: Slow Your Roll. Amy meets a skeleton, some serial killers and an interior designer with a vulgar streak(n)

programme.title: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Concerts - Live!
programme.desc: Watch Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductees perform live in concert in these one-time performances!(n)

programme.title: Get on track with Cue
programme.desc: Discover the best vaping experience available. Cue Vapor is vaping made simple. A spill-proof, easy to use, disposable cartridge vaping system available in a variety of colors and flavors(n)

programme.title: Cold Plasma Sub-D by Nicholas Perricone, M.D.
programme.desc: Does your neck make you look years older? Look dramatically younger with a visibly firmer, smoother, sexier neck! Courtney Thorne-Smith unveils Cold Plasma Sub-D by Perricone MD. Buy it and get Dr. Perricone's Blue Plasma "un-peel" for FREE!(n)

programme.title: PiYo Craze!
programme.desc: Define your body with PiYo. Chalene Johnson's new lower-impact workout series combining the muscle-sculpting benefits of Pilates, Yoga and fluid motion all-in-one!(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My House. Dr. Cox feels a bit like the title character of the TV show "House" when he's confronted with solving three mysteries: two are medical-related, and the third involves Elliot, who is angry at Kelso, but taking it out on Turk. Meanwhile, Carla seems to be experiencing the baby blues, and J.D. tries to make himself the perfect boyfriend for Kim (Elizabeth Banks). Headrick: Dave Foley(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Friend With Money. Elliot has to deal with being called a private-practice "sell out", Turk has to have a talk with Carla, and Dr Cox & the Janitor take advantage of the new hospital luxury suite(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Vanstock. The gang plans to go to Van Stock; unemployment takes its toll on Red(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: I Love Cake. Bob and Midge's marital troubles spill over into a fight over Donna's affection(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Sleepover. Eric is ecstatic when Donna spends the night(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Eric Gets Suspended. Donna's cigarette gets Eric suspended; Fez and Hyde have a double blind date; Jackie wants her stuffed animals in Kelso's van(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Red's Birthday. Red's birthday is celebrated by Bob and Midge---and their dates; Donna confides in Hyde, but not Eric(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Laurie Moves Out. Eric's joy and Red's stress over Laurie's moving in with another girl both increase when they meet her roommate---Mike. And, Kelso tries to explain to Jackie how his shirt got in Laurie's old room(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Eric's Stash. Red and Bob take the guys deer hunting; Hyde chills out, Fez bags dinner using only a few primitive weapons, Kelso is a menace with his gun, and Red and Eric bond in the deer blind(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Hunting. Red and Eric try to bond on a hunting trip with the guys, while the women back home play a friendly game of poker instead of discussing Donna and Eric. Red: Kurtwood Smith. Midge: Tanya Roberts. Eric: Topher Grace. Fez: Wilmer Valderrama. Kelso: Ashton Kutcher. Hyde: Danny Masterson(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Growing up is bad enough, without having to do it in 70's America. Follow a group of friends as they do battle with hormones, parents and dodgy fashion(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Burning Down the House. Growing up is bad enough, without having to do it in '70s America. Follow a group of friends as they do battle with hormones, parents and dodgy fashion(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The First Time. Donna has finally made Eric a man; he's overjoyed about it until he hears that things didn't go as well as he thought they had(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Afterglow. Donna and Eric bemoan the lack of fireworks during their special night; Red buys a motorcycle(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Kitty and Eric's Night Out. Jackie misses Fez's attention when he gets a girlfriend, who passed up Hyde; Eric and Kitty go to a movie together(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Lil' Crime Stoppers. The boys start up a crime club to solve local crimes, and are successful in finding a missing doll(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: A Million Little Fibers. Towlie writes his memoirs and it's not long before he's invited onto The Oprah Winfrey Show, but Oprah's vagina and anus are plotting against her..(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Erection Day. Jimmy has trouble controlling his hormones right before the big talent show(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: I'm a Little Bit Country. Mr Garrison gets angry when he discovers the boys don't know who the Founding Fathers are. Cartman tries to induce a flashback to 1776 to find out what the fuss is all about(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Chef Goes Nanners. Political correctness takes another round of satiric jabs from this pointedly irreverent episode of South Park. Chef intends to change the seemingly racist banner South Park claims as its flag. He gets support from young Wendy Testaburger, but her concentration is undermined by her attraction to the admittedly disgusting Cartman. programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.sub-title: Body of Evidence: The Tom Capano Trial
programme.desc: Body of Evidence: The Tom Capano Trial. A&E investigates the deadly consequences of unrequited love in the one-hour American Justice: Body of Evidence -- The Tom Capano Trial. Wealthy and well-connected, Tom Capano was still subjected to the torments of the heart. When an affair with Anne Marie Fahey ended badly, he snapped. After murdering his ex-lover, Capano dumped her body in the water, a seemingly clever move. However, Capano never counted on the guilty conscience of his own brother to secure his undoing. The police kept the jealous boyfriend under surveillance until they had the sibling's confession as accomplice. Surprisingly, at trial, Capano himself admitted to removing the body. But, he held onto the claim that Fahey was killed by someone else. Capano was convicted and sentenced to death(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: A Warrant to Kill. The murder of a woman by off-duty former sheriff's deputy Joseph Kent McGowen in 1992 is recalled. Host: Bill Kurtis(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Cop Killers. A special place in history is reserved for those that murder policemen. They are hunted and remembered by fellow officers. Their deeds often merit stiffer penalties and unforgiving jurors. A&E explores the most notorious of this lot in the one-hour American Justice: Cop Killers. Named after an Ice-T song that attracted negative attention for its hateful lyrics, the program follows a man who blames music for his deed. Ronald Ray Howard claims rap made him assassinate a policeman during a routine traffic stop. Leroy Strachan was convicted 40 years after he murdered a cop for telling him not to enter a ballpark after hours. Perhaps most well-known is the videotaped killing of Texas Constable Darrell Lunsford who stopped a car transporting drugs. His dashboard camera captured it all. A&E also visits the officers who dedicate their lives to finding cop killers and the prosecutors who put them away(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Grace is summoned to a Soho brothel, where a woman is holding a man at knifepoint, claiming he knows the whereabouts of her 16-year-old sister, who has been missing for six months. Revisiting the familiar case, the detective feels guilty she did not do more to help the family earlier. When a body is found, she follows a lead to the missing girl's old teacher, who had acted as her support buddy when she turned to prostitution to pay for her heroin habit, and nearly loses control when she is overcome by anger in the interrogation room. Ian Kelsey guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A convicted murderer reaching the end of his sentence learns his 15-year-old daughter has disappeared and the Sun Hill detectives suspect revenge is involved when investigations reveal she had been going out with the victim's son. Pippa Haywood guest stars as the bitter widow who refuses to co-operate with the inquiry, fearing she may lose her son as well as her husband.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mickey goes undercover as a homeless man to investigate the mystery of a body found in the river wearing a down-and-out's coat over designer clothes. Having eliminated the dead man's ex-fiancee from the inquiries, he gains the trust of a girl living on the streets and discovers the entire homeless community of Sun Hill lives in fear of a shady character known only as Greg. Back at the station, Millie signs off from her final shift.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Conclusion. After another night undercover on the streets, Mickey learns a second down-and-out has been murdered. The fears of the homeless community are underlined when Mickey's informant is badly beaten and suspicion falls on property developer Greg Simm (guest star Ralph Ineson), who has form for fraud and deception. It emerges the suspect had trouble with squatters holding up work on a development site, but evidence against him is hard to find. A bigger shock for Mickey is the news his new friend Nicola is in the frame for the murder.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Newly qualified midwife Jenny Lee prepares to begin her career and is posted to Nonnatus House in London, but what she assumed was a small private hospital turns out to be a nursing convent in the East End. Initially daunted by her new colleagues and surroundings, she slowly finds her feet and is given her first case - the care of a woman pregnant for the 25th time. Jessica Raine, Jenny Agutter, Pam Ferris and Judy Parfitt star in the drama, set in the 1950s and based on the best-selling memoirs of Jennifer Worth.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny sets out to help a heavily pregnant teenage girl who escaped an abusive life in Ireland and made her way to London, only to be taken in by a cafe owner who forced her into prostitution. Meanwhile, new midwife Chummy (Miranda Hart) arrives at Nonnatus House, and despite an overwhelming eagerness to please, she makes slow progress - a problem not helped by her inability to ride a bicycle. Jessica Raine and Amy McAllister co-star in the period medical drama.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is placed on the district nursing roster to improve her experience of community practice, and grows close to an ailing veteran soldier (guest star Roy Hudd). Trixie and Cynthia welcome a new patient to the antenatal clinic, a fortysomething woman who is upset by her pregnancy, despite her husband's joy. But at the birth, everyone gets a surprise. Drama, with Jessica Raine, Laura Main, Bryony Hannah and Miranda Hart.(n)

programme.desc: Feature-length drama about one man's journey through love and war in the early part of the 20th century. Charlie MacFell returns from university to the family farm, where his strict father still rules with an iron fist - a situation that soon changes thanks to a misunderstanding with a foolish farmhand. Lloyd Owen stars, with Catherine Zeta-Jones, Tom Bell and Maria Mile.(n)

programme.title: The Musketeers
programme.desc: A former Musketeer unexpectedly returns to Paris, throwing the quartet into turmoil as they are fully aware they should report him for desertion. But he has information on the infamous massacre during which his troop was killed and wants old friend Aramis's help in uncovering the truth. The only problem is, his arrival has coincided with a visit from the king's sister and her husband, the Duke of Savoy - and the regiment have been assigned to protect the royal couple. Swashbuckling drama, with Vincent Regan and JJ Feild.(n)

programme.title: The Mrs Bradley Mysteries
programme.desc: The sleuth visits a seaside resort with chauffeur George to attend his daughter Cecily's wedding, but ends up investigating a grisly ritual murder. programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jack turns out to have a personal connection to the prime suspect in a teenage girl's murder, so he is taken off the case and replaced with another forensic scientist seconded to the Lyell Centre. But he finds himself instinctively drawn into the investigation, alienating himself from Nikki and the team as he tries to find an alibi for the supposed killer. Meanwhile, the victim's best friend is consumed with guilt, leading her to take drastic action. Crime drama, starring David Caves, Emilia Fox and Richard Lintern, with guest appearances by Haydn Gwynne and Ashley Walters.(n)

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: The American president makes an unscheduled trip to Britain, forcing MI5 to work with the CIA to ensure his safety throughout the visit. Tom and Christine are thrown together, and it soon appears there's more to their relationship than just work - but with each new threat turning the operation into a power struggle between the rival organisations, they need to keep their minds firmly on the job.(n)

programme.title: Fallen Angel
programme.desc: Part two of three. Vanessa's research into an Edwardian priest who was thrown out of the Church for his macabre practices provides fuel for Rosie's confused religious beliefs as she loses her grip on sanity. With Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Fallen Angel

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The arrest of a Turkish girl who has been working illegally leads Ucos to reopen the case of Richard Gibson, a pub landlord who died in a fire in 2009. The original investigation concluded Gibson's death was probably suicide due to his dire financial situation, but the detectives have some questions about the pub's live-in barmaid, who disappeared on the night of the blaze. Could widowed landlady Joanne, pub regular Jason, or the dead man's best friend David, who happens to have a sideline in passing off his British-produced sparkling wine as French champagne, supply them with any answers? While the case tests the team's brain power, Sasha is also keen to raise their fitness levels as she signs them up for a five-a-side football competition. Phil Davis, Niamh Cusack and Tom Georgeson guest star.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: An outing to see Dwayne's favourite group is cut short by the murder of the lead singer, who was not exactly popular. He regularly annoyed his bandmates with his pre-performance relaxation routine, which involved lying in a coffin below stage for 15 minutes - prompting Richard and Camille to wonder whether it was enough for any of them to want him dead for real. Caribbean crime drama, guest starring Keith Duffy, Ray Fearon and Robbie Gee.(n)

programme.desc: A former sex kitten tells a tabloid newspaper all about her promiscuous past, much to the disgust of villagers, and later suffers a tragic accident that leaves her in a coma. Shortly after, she is spotted making her way to church, remorseful and ready to seek forgiveness for her sins. Jonathan and Maddy are baffled but not convinced that her recovery has a supernatural explanation. Emma Kennedy guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: The duo investigate the case of a murdered drug-runner who seems to have returned from the dead to exact vengeance on his killers using the power of voodoo. Offbeat drama, starring Alan Davies, Caroline Quentin and Stuart Milligan, with a guest appearance by Jonathan Ross.(n)

programme.title: Bring It On: Fight to the Finish

programme.title: Bring It On: In It to Win It

programme.title: Bring It On
programme.desc: The hard work, dedication, and personal politics behind "rah rah rah!" and "sis boom bah!" go under the microscope in this engaging teen comedy. Torrance Shipman (Kirsten Dunst) discovers that being captain of her San Diego high school's six-time championship-winning cheerleading squad is more complicated than she had imagined. Torrance's parents want her to spend more time on her homework, her boyfriend wants her to spend more time with him, and she learns that the squad's former captain stole some of their best routines from other teams -- and that Isis (Gabrielle Union), captain of a top squad at a crosstown, inner-city high school, plans to fight back this year. To make things worse, when one of the cheerleaders is injured, Torrance is forced to replace her with Missy (Eliza Dushku), a cynical new kid who is involved only because the school doesn't offer gymnastics. In the midst of this chaos, with the national championship around the corner, Torrance couldn't have picked a worse time to fall in love with Cliff (Jesse Bradford), a classmate who cares a lot more about punk rock than school spirit. Dunst trained with a cheerleading squad for her role, though a double performed the more complicated stunts(n)

programme.desc: Leonard meets up with the woman he kissed during his trip in the hope of setting Penny's mind at ease, while Sheldon films a special episode of Fun with Flags after his break-up with Amy. Bernadette feels guilty about keeping a secret from Penny.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The boys want to become more sporty, so Barry Kripke leads them in a fencing lesson, while Penny, Amy and Bernadette help Stuart, who wants to attract more female customers to the comic-book store.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy spend Thanksgiving together as friends, while Howard reluctantly agrees to volunteer at a soup kitchen with Bernadette, Raj and Emily.(n)

Comedy, guest starring June Squibb.(n)

programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy host a Valentine's Day episode of Fun with Flags, while Leonard and Penny grapple with getting older. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon goes to great lengths to convince Amy that they should have a baby together after they successfully complete a scientific experiment using DNA samples from both of them.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides another team of five well-known faces on an epic adventure through four fantastical zones - Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Futuristic. In each zone the team must tackle physical, skill, mystery and mental challenges in a bid to win crystals. These elusive crystals each give them five seconds inside the iconic Crystal Dome, where they hope to collect gold tokens to convert into prizes. This instalment sees adventurers Steve Jones, Scarlett Moffatt, David Coulthard, Joey Essex and team captain Jodie Kidd hope to conquer the maze, in support of the charity Stand Up to Cancer.(n)

However, things do not quite work out as planned. Comedy based on the TV series, with Joe Thomas, Simon Bird, James Buckley and Blake Harrison.(n)

programme.desc: Vampire warrior Selene returns to life after spending years in cryonic suspension by a scientist. Escaping from the facility where she is being held, she finds humans have discovered the existence of the undead and are planning to wipe them out, a new breed of mutant werewolves has emerged, and her super-powered daughter holds the key to ending the conflict. Action fantasy, with Kate Beckinsale, India Eisley and Stephen Rea.(n)

programme.desc: The friends undergo health checks following the death of Marshall's father. Robin dates a man who reminds the gang of a dog, and Barney denies that he has feelings for Nora. American comedy, guest starring Robbie Amell.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Marshall's decision to quit his job at the bank and volunteer for an environmental group has repercussions for everyone, and Ted and Zoey reach an impasse over their differing views about the future of the Arcadian. Comedy, starring Josh Radnor, Jason Segel and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.desc: Joe starts to search for another job as he realises Lennox and Ryder are old enough to look after themselves, however Mel does not want him to go and tries to show him how important he is to her and her family. Comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Robin tries to find her `something old', which she buried in Central Park years previously in preparation for her potential future wedding. Meanwhile, Marshall and Lily ask Ted to help them pack for their trip to Italy, and Barney bonds with Robin's father.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

Meanwhile, Jeffords uses Santiago and Gina for inspiration when he writes a book about his daughters, and Captain Holt's nephew visits Brooklyn and makes an instant impression on Diaz. Comedy, guest starring Kyra Sedgwick and Nick Cannon.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
