programme.title: NBA: The Jump
programme.desc: The Jump brings you all the very latest news from the NBA with regular appearances by current and former players, plus insight from analysts, reporters and insiders.(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: The Book of Manning. This documentary explores the rich history of the Manning family, a clan that has had two generations of success playing football in the SEC. Father Archie Manning was a hero at the University of Mississippi before going on to a career in the NFL with the New Orleans Saints. While his oldest son suffers from a condition that cut short his playing career, Peyton and Eli Manning created even greater legacies both in that highly-competitive college conference, and in the NFL(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Rand University. Wide receiver Randy Moss's incredible journey from an isolated town called Rand in West Virginia to the top of the NFL(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Shaq & Dale. A look at the on-going relationship between LSU basketball icons Shaquille O'Neal and Dale Brown, who spent 1989-92 together in Baton Rouge after first meeting in Germany when Shaq was 13. Narrated by Louisiana native Tim McGraw(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Brian and The Boz. Documentary in which former Oklahoma linebacker Brian Bosworth looks back on the mistakes he made as his alter ego 'The Boz', and passes along the lessons he learned to his son(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Sole Man. The rise of sports-marketing pioneer Sonny Vaccaro, who was instrumental in launching Nike's "Air Jordan" empire in the '80s and ushered in a new era of high-school hoops in the '90s(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: I Hate Christian Laettner. A profile of former Duke University basketball stand-out Christian Laettner. Laettner's career at Duke was a lightning rod of attention - along with Coach Mike Krzyzewski, Laettner led the Blue Devils to back-to-back National Championship, while drawing the collective ire of the nation for his cocky and privileged appearance. Director Rory Karpf breaks down the cult of personality that still surrounds Laettner to this day(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Gospel According to Mac. Polarizing football coach Bill McCartney and his revitalization of the Colorado Buffaloes is chronicled, examining off-the-field lows as well as the high of a 1990 national title. McCartney was founder of the Promise Keepers, a Christian men's ministry. Directed by Jim Podhoretz(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Trojan War. This sports documentary probes the University of Southern California's return to the elite of college football under head coach Pete Carroll and the program's precipitous fall from grace when the NCAA hit the school with sanctions. Originally aired on ESPN as part of the network's acclaimed "30 for 30" series, this feature-length doc uses interviews with Carroll, Matt Leinart, LenDale White, and many more to encapsulate the rise and fall of the Trojans during Carroll's nine-year reign at USC. Directed by Aaron Rahsaan Thomas, who studied film at USC in the midst of Carroll's tenure as head coach(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: The Walk Off. Chronicling LSU's dramatic 1996 College World Series win on a championship-game walk-off home run by diminutive infielder Warren Morris. Director Kenan K. Holley revisits one of college baseball's signature moments, 20 years later(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Fantastic Lies. A 10-year retrospective on the 2006 Duke lacrosse case in which three players were charged with rape, only to have all charges dropped a year later. Director Marina Zenovich explores the case's hot-button issues of sex, race, class and violence, and the turbulent period's lasting impact on the players and the program(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Before They Were Cowboys. Chronicling Jerry Jones and Jimmy Johnson in their days as Arkansas football teammates--part of an undefeated national champion squad in 1964--long before joining forces to win two Super Bowls with the Dallas Cowboys. Directed by Corey Frost(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Phi Slama Jama. The high-flying Houston Cougars basketball squad of the early '80s is chronicled, featuring Hakeem Olajuwon, Clyde Drexler and others from Guy Lewis's three straight Final Four teams. Also: role player Benny Anders' disappearance. Directed by Chip Rives(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: One and Not Done. Chronicling the career of Hall of Fame basketball coach John Calipari, an accomplished yet controversial figure who has embraced the era of one-year stays by top college players. Marcus Camby, Derrick Rose and Anthony Davis are among those interviewed by director Jonathan Hock(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Catholics vs. Convicts. The epic 1988 Miami-Notre Dame football matchup is chronicled by director Patrick Creadon, a Notre Dame senior that year with unique insight into the game's controversial t-shirt. Players and coaches reflect on the emotionally-charged day in South Bend(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The U. Filmmaker Billy Corben, a Miami native and University of Miami alum, will tell the story of how the Bad Boys of football changed the attitude of the game they played, and how this serene campus was transformed into The U(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The U Part 2. Chronicling University of Miami football from the low of NCAA sanctions in the mid-'90s to the high of the 2001 National Championship; to the new controversy of a booster's Ponzi scheme to win favor with the program. Directed by Billy Corben(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Pony Exce$$. The tale of how power, corruption and greed threatened to kill off a Dallas university's once-proud American football team forever(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Youngstown Boys. An exploration of the class and power dynamics in college sports through the interconnected journeys of one-time dynamic running back Maurice Clarett and former elite head coach Jim Tressel. Clarett and Tressel emerged from opposite sides of the tracks in Youngstown, Ohio, and then joined up for a magical season at Ohio State University in 2002 that produced the first national football championship for the school in over 30 years. Shortly after, Clarett was suspended from college football and began a downward spiral that ended with a prison term. Tressel continued at Ohio State for another eight years before his career there also ended in scandal. Also available in HD(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Requiem for the Big East. Chronicling the origin of the Big East Conference and its rapid 1980s rise under commissioner Dave Gavitt and iconic basketball coaches including John Thompson, Lou Carnesecca and Jim Boeheim. Director Ezra Edelman also examines the conference's new era as a non-football league(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Thunder and Lightning. A 30-year retrospective on the standout 1985 Mississippi State Bulldogs baseball squad, with star hitters Will Clark and Rafael Palmeiro and pitchers Jeff Brantley and Bobby Thigpen. Directed by Rory Karpf(n)

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia(n)

programme.title: The Snow Wolf Family and Me
programme.desc: Part one of two. Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan hopes to get closer to wild wolves than anyone before to discover the true nature of this feared predator and heads to the north of Canada in search of a pack that has never seen people and so has no fear of humans. He begins to gain the trust of an Arctic wolf family and as time passes becomes accepted by the pack, including a female and its three newborn pups, and has some close encounters that reveal a softer side to the animals.(n)

programme.title: The Snow Wolf Family and Me
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Buchanan returns to Canada in the autumn to reunite with the Arctic wolves he has been following as they try to raise their pups and prepare for winter. The cameraman also walks with members of the pack as they hunt lemmings, musk oxen and hares and encounter a rival pack.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Lobo: The Wolf That Changed America.
programme.desc: Revealing why Ernest Thompson Seton's book about his experiences in 1893, when he set out to kill a wolf that was slaughtering cattle, became the first to portray the animals in a positive light. His account inspired naturalists and changed the way many Americans saw their wilderness. David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Polar Bear Town
programme.desc: The bears are set to be released from their holding facility as winter sets in.(n)

programme.title: Polar Bear Town
programme.desc: The Polar bear season in Manitoba, Canada is now over, and the bear females head south to give birth.(n)

programme.title: The Snow Wolf Family and Me
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Buchanan returns to Canada in the autumn to reunite with the Arctic wolves he has been following as they try to raise their pups and prepare for winter. The cameraman also walks with members of the pack as they hunt lemmings, musk oxen and hares and encounter a rival pack.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Lobo: The Wolf That Changed America.
programme.desc: Revealing why Ernest Thompson Seton's book about his experiences in 1893, when he set out to kill a wolf that was slaughtering cattle, became the first to portray the animals in a positive light. His account inspired naturalists and changed the way many Americans saw their wilderness. David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Polar Bear Town
programme.desc: The bears are set to be released from their holding facility as winter sets in.(n)

programme.title: Polar Bear Town
programme.desc: The Polar bear season in Manitoba, Canada is now over, and the bear females head south to give birth.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Miracle Orphans
programme.desc: Presenters Ellie Harrison and Max Hug Williams follow orphaned baby animals as they make steps to return to the wild.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: Shedding light on the behaviour of animals that migrate.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the connections between the wildlife, landscape and people of the Arabian peninsula. The first edition features animals including oryxes, jerboas, horned vipers and scorpions, and a journey with the Bedouin - camel-riding nomads who are the only humans to have mastered the art of survival in the desert. Narrated by Alexander Siddig.(n)

programme.title: Conquerors
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the lionfish, which eats other predators and has conquered such a large area of ocean that it has been described as the worst invasive species on the planet.(n)

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.sub-title: Tigers About the House - What Happened Next.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Clarks see the harsh reality of poaching in Indonesia when they visit tigers that were caught in snares, prompting Giles to concoct an ambitious plan to save the injured big cats in the wild. Back in Australia, Spot and Stripe are days away from their first birthday and will no longer be classed as cubs, while Spot faces an operation that may end with him losing all vision.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough's documentary charting the circle of life in the animal kingdom ends with creatures' attempts to rear their offspring, revealing the commitment involved and how for some parents it means risking their own lives. A turtle hauls itself up the beach to lay its eggs in a safe place, only for the tide to trap it behind a wall of coral. A mother bonobo in the Congo teaches its son the skills it will need to survive adulthood, bison protect their calves from the ever-present threat of wolves and a mother zebra has to lead its foal across a dangerous river.(n)

programme.title: Tarsier Tails
programme.desc: At White Rock Tower, youngster Santoso is given hunting lessons by big sister Poppy.(n)

programme.title: Navy SEALs
programme.desc: While rescuing a US air crew captured by terrorists, a team of Navy SEALs discover that the terrorists possess powerful missiles(n)

programme.title: Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
programme.desc: Comedy road trip, or post modern discussion on the pros and cons of independent movie-making? Kevin Clerks Smith calls in favours from big stars like Ben Affleck and Matt Damon to bolster his tale of two blunt-hitting slackers heading to Hollywood(n)

programme.title: Superstar
programme.desc: Molly Shannon recreates her Saturday Night Live persona as a coltish Catholic schoolgirl who dreams of becoming a Hollywood star and marrying the best-looking boy in school. Look out for Tom Green, better known as the star of Road Trip and husband of Drew Barrymore(n)

programme.title: Running Scared
programme.desc: Lighthearted drama about two disillusioned Chicago cops who have one last try at catching a dangerous drugs baron before they quit the force to run a bar in the Florida Keys(n)

programme.title: Days of Thunder
programme.desc: Cole Trickle (Tom Cruise) doesn't know much about stock-car racing, but he's growing into the job, with a series of wins under his belt soon after just beginning. Almost killed in a racing accident, his convalescence in the hospital is lightened somewhat by a beautiful doctor (Nicole Kidman). After returning to the track, however, Trickle seems to have lost his nerve and must steel his resolve to become a champion once more(n)

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: A Mexican village is at the mercy of Calvera, the leader of a band of outlaws. The townspeople, too afraid to fight for themselves, hire seven American gunslingers to free them from the bandits' raids. The professional gunmen train the villagers to defend themselves then plan a trap for the evil Calvera(n)

programme.title: Navy SEALs
programme.desc: While rescuing a US air crew captured by terrorists, a team of Navy SEALs discover that the terrorists possess powerful missiles(n)

programme.title: Summer Rental
programme.desc: A harried suburbanite gets into a number of misadventures during a family vacation that culminates in a boat race(n)

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: Colonel Matrix (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is retired and living peaceably with his 10-year-old daughter (Alyssa Milano) when she is kidnapped by the henchmen of an exiled Latin American dictator. The dictator's plan is to reinstate himself in power by eliminating the president of his country, using Matrix to kill him (or he will kill the kidnapped daughter). Matrix escapes from the plane that is supposed to be carrying him to his mission and then proceeds to go from one violent confrontation to the next as he hunts down the dictator and moves to rescue his daughter. Helping him is Cindy (Rae Dawn Chong), who has her own reasons for wanting the dictator dead(n)

programme.title: Days of Thunder

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop
programme.desc: A detective pursues a friend's killer through Southern California, where he tweaks authority, tumbles with the bad guys and bends the rules(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop II
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy returns as Axel Foley, the loud-mouthed cop from Detroit who's back to shake up Beverly Hills after chief Andrew Bogomil is nearly killed. Teaming up again with Det Billy Rosewood, who's developed an unhealthy liking for firepower under Foley's influence, and Det Sgt John Taggart, they set out to crack the 'Alphabet Crimes' - robberies from heavily guarded premises. Chief suspect is Maxwell Dent, who's protected by heavy Charlie 'Chips' Cain and assassin Karla Fry. And it's not long before the quiet of Beverly Hills is shattered by car chases and shoot-outs in Tony Scott's comedy cop-thriller(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop III
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy and Judge Reinhold star in John Landis's contribution to the action comedy franchise. Axel Foley is once again dragged away from his routine police work in Detroit when evidence is discovered linking the shooting of his boss to a counterfeiting outfit in California. It's not long before the unconventional cop is back in the famous Los Angeles suburb and teamed up with his old buddy, detective Billy Rosewood, to discover the illegal goings on in a local tourist attraction called Wonder World..(n)

programme.title: Superstar
programme.desc: Molly Shannon recreates her Saturday Night Live persona as a coltish Catholic schoolgirl who dreams of becoming a Hollywood star and marrying the best-looking boy in school. Look out for Tom Green, better known as the star of Road Trip and husband of Drew Barrymore(n)

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: Anarchic, nihilistic satire on modern life in which an office worker who feels emotionally deadened by his consumerist lifestyle has a chance encounter with a charismatic man. Finding that they are kindred spirits, the two men start up a no-holds-barred bare-knuckle fighting club, with the aim of making its members feel 'alive' once again. Based on Chuck Palahniuk's novel(n)

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: Colonel Matrix (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is retired and living peaceably with his 10-year-old daughter (Alyssa Milano) when she is kidnapped by the henchmen of an exiled Latin American dictator. The dictator's plan is to reinstate himself in power by eliminating the president of his country, using Matrix to kill him (or he will kill the kidnapped daughter). Matrix escapes from the plane that is supposed to be carrying him to his mission and then proceeds to go from one violent confrontation to the next as he hunts down the dictator and moves to rescue his daughter. Helping him is Cindy (Rae Dawn Chong), who has her own reasons for wanting the dictator dead(n)

programme.title: PCU
programme.desc: Actor Hart Bochner turns director in the satirical Animal House update P.C.U.. Per the title, the film takes place on the campus of a University where, thanks to militant dean Jessica Walter, Political Correctness has reached ridiculous proportions. A group of dorm-room cutups, wallowing in their uncorrectness, declares war on the uptight student activists who call the shots. Saturday Night Live's David Spade is among the leading players; while he's funnier here than in his costarring stints in Chris Farley's films, he doesn't have much to work with. The subject matter covered in P.C.U. has already been tackled, with far funnier results, on Bill Maher's cable-TV weekly Politically Incorrect(n)

programme.title: A Very Brady Sequel
programme.desc: A man impersonating Carol Brady's first husband schemes to get his hands on a priceless family heirloom. Questions then arise about the legality of Mike and Carol's marriage, and the relationship between the Brady brothers and sisters(n)

programme.title: Summer Rental
programme.desc: A harried suburbanite gets into a number of misadventures during a family vacation that culminates in a boat race(n)

programme.title: Dan in Real Life
programme.desc: A widower and father of three who also writes a parenting advice column for his local newspaper falls for the girlfriend of his younger brother during a family vacation in director Peter Hedges' offbeat love-triangle laugher. Steve Carell stars as the writer who finds his widely known convictions put to the ultimate test, with Dane Cook and Juliette Binoche respectively assuming the roles of the younger sibling and his radiant girlfriend(n)

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: Anarchic, nihilistic satire on modern life in which an office worker who feels emotionally deadened by his consumerist lifestyle has a chance encounter with a charismatic man. Finding that they are kindred spirits, the two men start up a no-holds-barred bare-knuckle fighting club, with the aim of making its members feel 'alive' once again. Based on Chuck Palahniuk's novel(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots!
programme.desc: Top Gun meets Airplane! Ace pilot Topper Harley is asked to come back to the Navy for a special assignment (he dropped out to go live with Native Americans after an incident made him doubt his abilities). He has personality conflicts with the other Top Gun, as they are both romantically interested in the same woman(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots! Part Deux
programme.desc: The last three missions to retrieve hostages from a heavily fortified prison in the Middle East have failed, so President Tug Benson decides to call in Topper Harley. Giving Harley control of a crack team of commandos, he sends him deep into enemy territory - somewhere between Iraq and Ahardplace! This sequel features a number of spoofs of the 'Rambo' movies, not to mention 'Robin Hood' and a whole host of others(n)

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: Monumental biopic of the great but controversial US military general, George S Patton. The film follows his World War II career from his triumphs over Rommel in North Africa, through his demotion for mistreating a soldier under his command and up to the Battle of the Bulge. George C Scott's towering performance earned him an Oscar, which he refused to accept(n)

programme.title: Sons of Liberty
programme.desc: A Dangerous Game. Part 1 of 3. Sam Adams is pursued by British authorities; riots break out in Boston(n)

programme.title: Sons of Liberty

programme.title: Sons of Liberty
programme.desc: Independence. The Revolutionary War begins(n)

programme.desc: Waterlogged sequel with the disaster-prone Annie Porter, this time battling a madman on a cruise ship with the help of her new boyfriend(n)

programme.desc: A town full of humans, zombies, and vampires living in co-existence are thrust into an all-out war when aliens invade. Now, three teenagers must defeat the newest visitors to restore the peace(n)

programme.title: Eddie Macon's Run
programme.desc: Chase thriller in which a wrongly imprisoned man manages to escape and heads for Mexico, with a ruthless sheriff in hot pursuit. This adaptation of James McLendon's novel featured the film debut of John Goodman(n)

programme.title: The Musketeer
programme.desc: Orphaned by a murderous man in black, young D'Artagnan grows up desperate to avenge the death of his musketeer father. But with ruthless Cardinal Richelieu plotting chaos in France, the novice swordsman must take action to become a musketeer and save his queen(n)

programme.title: Agent Cody Banks 2: Destination London
programme.desc: An embittered CIA agent plus an evil scientist means bad news for pint-sized spy Cody. Their plot jeopardises a meeting of the world's leaders in London. Cody must act as a musical prodigy to find out more, but playing the clarinet is sometimes harder than spying(n)

programme.title: Godzilla vs. Destoroyah
programme.desc: On the island Godzilla and Little Godzilla call home, something is amiss -- Godzilla's level of radioactive energy is growing out of control, giving him a decidedly unhealthy glow. The G-Force, who keep watch over the big guy and his activities, try to cool him off by freezing him, but soon both Godzilla and his minders have to deal with a new enemy. A pack of creatures have mutated from Godzilla's cells, and evil forces have gotten control of the Oxygen Destroyer that nearly killed Godzilla in his first film encounter. Godzilla vs. Destoroyah was the last film in the Japanese Godzilla series prior to Roland Emmerich's American variation released in 1998; Toho, however, announced in 1999 that they intended to begin a new series of films wit the original monster(n)

programme.desc: Bill Racklin is a deputy sheriff in Greer County Oklahoma, the crystal meth capital of the region. The drug lord arranges Annie's kidnapping and holds her to ransom his brother(n)

programme.desc: This incredible biopic follows Cleveland union rep Danny Greene (Ray Stevenson), who earned notoriety in the mid-'70s for his willingness to defy the Italian mob. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American crime drama returns with the team still reeling from the Department of Defence investigation, with Ziva, McGee and Tony having handed in their badges. Parsons continues his inquiries into Gibbs and his agents, but events take a turn when an explosion kills the Secretary of the US Navy and seriously injures the director of Homeland Security. When attempts are made on the lives of Gibbs and Tony, it appears that all of the NCIS agents are in mortal danger. Starring Mark Harmon and Colin Hanks.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sarah Porter, the new Secretary of the Navy, charges Gibbs and the team with finding terrorist group the Brotherhood of Doubt, which was responsible for killing her predecessor. She expects the group's next target to be billionaire Tomas Mendez, who spends his money trying to defeat terrorism, but whose motives may not be entirely altruistic. Meanwhile, Tony flies to Tel Aviv, where new Mossad director Orli Elbaz reveals they have a report of a possible sighting of Ziva at a kibbutz she went to as a child. Crime drama, guest starring Marina Sirtis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An explosion at an apartment building brings navy officer Terence Keith to the team's attention and it transpires he had been on medication for anxiety, a condition that had led to him being ejected from a pilot's training course. Ducky's profile of Keith suggests that he may be unstable and about to exact revenge for having his dream of becoming a fighter ace taken away from him, and evidence points to him intending to carry out a suicide attack.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is found murdered and Gibbs and McGee are called in when she is discovered to be carrying ID bearing the name Sgt Patricia Moreno, a US marine known to have died several years earlier. The victim is discovered to have come to America from Afghanistan and a necklace reveals a fingerprint that leads the team to a known assassin. Guest starring Lolita Davidovich.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team investigate when naval cryptanalyst Andrew Wells is shot dead in a park outside Baltimore. At the scene, Tony spots a man who was one of his informants from 15 years earlier when he was a police officer, but who went into hiding after a bid to bring down the Russian mobsters he worked for went wrong. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane suspects that a state prison inmate is to blame for the murder of a guard who was stabbed to death outside a jewellery shop, and Rigsby decides to find out what his criminal father knows about the killing. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Owain Yeoman.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Members of the Northern California Symphony Orchestra come under suspicion when a violinist is murdered, and Cho encounters a young pickpocket. Crime drama, starring Tim Kang and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part series finale, a bank robber's suicide bombing outside a petrol station convenience shop leaves Jane suspecting there is more to the case than meets the eye. The incident is linked to the discovery of the body of a torture victim, and it transpires he was related to Hightower - who appears to be the target of serial killer Red John. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part series finale, Hightower wants to hand herself in, knowing she will be found innocent of Todd Johnson's murder, but Jane dissuades her, not wanting to risk scaring Red John underground. The consultant manages to inform all four suspects of her location and awaits the arrival of the accomplice, who he will use to track down the serial killer - only for Lisbon to get injured in the ploy. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Aunjanue Ellis.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is taken into custody for fatally shooting the man he believed to be serial killer Red John, but bluffs his way out of jail and tries to exonerate himself. He begins by visiting his victim's widow - and learns her house contains not only a secret room, but also a reluctant guest. Starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine's adoptive parents visit for an unannounced holiday with the family, and Stan becomes angry when they refuse to fall in with his `man of the house' attitude. Steve tries to impress a girl at school by living to the extreme.(n)

programme.desc: Stan uses CIA brainwashing techniques to stop Hayley leaving for France, but realises he will face deadly consequences unless he relinquishes his power over her. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger become private detectives.(n)

programme.desc: Brian goes to collect Stewie from Lois's parents' house in Palm Springs - but the duo lose their plane tickets in an airport bar, and find themselves with no choice but to stow away on board a train back to Quahog. Meanwhile, the Griffins try to spice up their marriage.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.desc: Francine becomes a surrogate mother for gay neighbours Terry and Greg, prompting an outraged Stan to kidnap the baby once she is born. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger think Klaus is out to get them.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A girl at a day-care centre steals Stewie's heart, and Peter persuades Lois to become a flight attendant so he can enjoy the benefits of free air travel around the world. Animated comedy, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter gets on the wrong side of socially inept gangster Big Fat Paulie, putting Lois in the sights of a hitman. programme.desc: Stan returns home from another dangerous mission to find Francine and the family have decorated the house for Christmas. programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine pretends to kidnap Roger after he has a fight with Stan, hoping to demonstrate how much he means to the family. However, when her agent husband refuses to pay the ransom, the alien is forced to rethink the way he treats people.(n)

programme.desc: An investigation is launched into the murder of a psychiatrist involved in the trial of a drug designed to treat teenage depression and anxiety. Meanwhile, Brenda's squad learns she was charged with sexual misconduct in her previous job in Atlanta. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates when the daughter of a congresswoman is raped and murdered in her home, and is drawn into a seedy underworld. The evidence prompts her to examine the victim's sexual predilections - and uncovers a secret that could make her the next victim. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer

programme.title: Whacked Out Sports
programme.desc: Generally telecast on the weekend late-night schedule, the half-hour Whacked Out Sports was a reality "clip" show devoted to unusual sports activities and embarrassing bloopers. The series' specialty seemed to be spotlighting eccentric contestants indulging in offbeat sports events with bizarre rules. In each market that the series played, viewers were invited to send in video clips of "crazy stuff never seen on TV" -- especially if "hot girls" were involved (that's what it said on the press release!). Seen on the NBC-owned stations in the larger markets, Whacked Out Sports was initially broadcast on September 7, 2006(n)

programme.title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: The web-slingin' wall-crawler hits the screens once again in this follow-up to Marc Webb's 2012 reboot of the series. Andrew Garfield returns as Peter Parker, who squares off against the villainous Electro, played by Jamie Foxx. As the film opens, we find Richard (Campbell Scott) and Mary Parker (Embeth Davitz) stealing away with some crucial Oscorp files while leaving young Peter in the care of Aunt May (Sally Field) and Uncle Ben. Flash forward about a decade, and Peter (Garfield) is swinging into action as Spider-Man; having successfully thwarted the hijacking of an Oscorp truck by notorious Russian criminal Aleksei Sytsevich (Paul Giamatti), Peter ditches the costume just in time to meet up with Gwen Stacy (Emma Stone) at their high school graduation. Despite his deep love for Emma, however, Peter remains haunted by his promise to her late father not to get emotionally involved with her for fear that she could be targeted by Spider-Man's enemies. Meanwhile, young Harry Osborne (Dane DeHaan) inherits OsCorp and a deadly retrovirus from his father Norman (Chris Cooper), and brilliant but timid OsCorp scientist Max Dillon (Jamie Foxx) gets infused with a powerful dose of electricity while attempting to fix a faulty power circuit in the lab. Upon regaining consciousness, Max discovers that he has the power to harness electrical currents - the higher the voltage the more powerful he becomes. When a battle with Max in Times Square shorts out Spidey's web-shooters, Peter goes to work on developing a more reliable model of his signature weapon while Harry grows convinced that Spider-Man's blood is the key to his survival. Later, villainous OsCorp chairman Donald Menken (Colm Feore) steals the company out right out from under Harry, driving the vengeful youth to break Max -- now Electro -- out of the heavily-guarded Ravencroft Institute for a two-pronged attack on Menken and Spider-Man. The stage for that battle is set when New York City goes dark just as Peter declares his love to Gwen, plunging the wise-cracking web-slinger into a fight that could forever alter the course of his life(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Faith Off. Given his short and undistinguished career in academia, Homer Simpson (voice of Dan Castellaneta) is surprised when he's invited to a ritzy social function at Springfield University, though Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) correctly guesses that he's been lured to a fund-raising event. Reunited with his pals Benjamin (voice of Harry Shearer), Doug (voice of Hank Azaria) and Gary (also voiced by Castellaneta), Homer decides they should play a prank on the Dean, which predictably backfires as Homer ends up with a bucket of Super Glue stuck to his head. Homer isn't able remove the bucket until he and his family attend a tent revival meeting led by traveling preacher Brother Faith (voice of Don Cheadle). Brother Faith claims he can channel his spiritual power through Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright), and the boy is able to remove the bucket; certain he has the gift of healing, Bart sets up his own revival, but realizes he has no special powers when his attempt to cure Milhouse (voice of Pamela Hayden) of his near-sightedness causes his friend to be hit by a car. Homer, however, still believes Bart can heal the sick, and when Springfield U's star kicker hurts his leg during the big game, he volunteers his son to mend the injury; as it happens, more than Springfield's pride is on the line when Bart learns local Mafiosi Fat Tony (voice of Joe Mantegna) has a lot of money riding on the game. "Faith Off" first aired on January 16, 2000(n)

programme.desc: Guy Fieri and Kid Rock travel through Detroit, and also try macaroni cheese in a renovated church in Clarkston, Michigan.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: The children compete by creating a dish using boar, in the hope of impressing judges Christ Santos, actress Ali Larter and Food Network Star contestant Arnold Myint.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Ministry of Food
programme.desc: Crusading chef Jamie Oliver sets out to help people make the most of their meagre pantries, inspired by the efforts of the wartime Ministry of Food. In Rotherham, Jamie meets a `Burger Mum' who once fed her children takeaways through the railings of their school's playground, and tries to teach a fast-food loving population the joys of preparing their own meals.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A team helps restaurant owners who suspect their employees are not doing their jobs correctly.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A team helps restaurant owners who suspect their employees are not doing their jobs correctly.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps the owners of a restaurant on a golf course, as the staff are left to fend for themselves while customers grow unhappy.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps the owners of Mario's Tutto Bene, a struggling family restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri sets out searching for a selection of seafood dishes, and stops by a barbecue joint in Des Moines serving up smoked chicken wings.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits an historic Des Moines, Iowa, drive-in famous for its chilli recipe, which is almost 100 years old.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy checks out a funky fusion joint serving up unique burritos. In Beaverdale, a southern spot's cooking up all the classics. In Atlantic City, a husband/wife duo dishes out soul food standouts.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri's taking a tasty tour through Tuscany in Italy. In Montecatini Alto, a hillside seafood spot serves up a squid ink specialty and a Mediterranean prawn-artichoke mashup.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri's hitting up totally traditional Italian spots in Florence. A 50-year-old landmark is serving up a legendary spaghetti specialty and some crazy good chicken.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy's going on a flavour filled tour of Scottsdale, Arizona. He tries an Italian beef specialty, a banging brisket at a barbecue gas station, then gets crazy at a burger joint.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten visits a restaurant where she discovers how to make the perfect burger with chef Laurent Tourondel, and an easy seafood chowder.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten shares her recipes for chocolate chunk blondies and cookies from the same batter.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten shares her favourite candy recipes, topped with marshmallows and white chocolate bark.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten creates easy canape recipes - a fresh salmon tartare and sopresatta with cheese in puff pastry.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Anna Olson prepares blueberry muffins and elegant hors d'oeuvres for the Eat to the Beat breast cancer fundraising event.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef prepares a ladies luncheon to celebrate her best friend's engagement, and gets started on a beetroot and buttermilk soup.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: A group of women artists reveal their not-so-healthy culinary creations as Ezra and Julie attempt to change their cooking habits and create a meal masterpiece.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes food that can be made in a hurry with recipes for a quick and easy apple tart and a speedy shrimp stir-fry.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond rustles up a frontier feast for her family who are hard at work building new pens on the ranch. She serves citrus-grilled pollo asado and cheesy beans.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Cowboy Josh is taking Alex on as his ranch apprentice, and Ree hopes to satisfy their big appetites by preparing supreme pizza burgers and a quick Italian salad.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: While the men are out cutting down cedar trees, Ree rustles up a casual lunch of rigatoni with chicken thighs and a salad with creamy dressing.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe embark on the second day of their culinary road trip. They reach Trawden in Lancashire and pull up beside the ruins of Wycoller Hall with one of their prize cheesecakes to compete in a garden show against some of the best local bakers. Along the way, they catch up with butcher Joseph Mellin to sample a delicacy.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe travel to Kirkby Lonsdale, Cumbria, where they enter the `dessert in a wine glass' category at the Lunesdale Country Show. They also meet gamekeeper Richard Wolfenden, who attends to the red grouse on Fourstones Moor, and he provides them with the luxury ingredient of freshly caught game.(n)

programme.title: Dinner At Tiffani's
programme.desc: Former Saved By the Bell star Tiffani Thiessen prepares snacks perfect for game night with her friends Ross Mathews, Jillian Barberie and Tim Meadows.(n)

programme.title: Dinner At Tiffani's
programme.desc: White Collar co-star Tim DeKay and his family join Tiffani, her husband Brady and their daughter Harper, for a family style feast. Tiffani prepares a kid-friendly menu that even the adults love. Watermelon Salad with Fresh Mint and Feta Cheese, a Pickle and Potato Salad, and tender and crispy Fried Chicken are served before clearing the table for dessert- Root Beer Floats with Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using strawberries grown in hanging baskets at his Essex plot. He uses the fruit to create a salad with speck and halloumi, rustles up a home-made jam to serve with a creamy rice pudding and presents his take on an old classic - grilled strawberries with Pimm's.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes using fresh peas and broad beans from his garden and demonstrates not only how easy they are to grow but also the bumper yield that can be achieved. He uses the vegetables as the final touches in a spaghetti and meatball dish, as well as creating `posh beans on toast' and a spicy fritter.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The culinary competition returns, with chefs battling it out for the opportunity to cook at a banquet at St Paul's Cathedral to mark the 70th anniversary of D-Day. The first edition features entrants from Northern Ireland, with returning finalist Raymond McArdle taking on Chris McGowan and Will Brown as they prepare the ideal starter for the feast. The hopefuls must impress a mystery Great British Menu veteran if they are to cook for judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Celia Sandys in the regional final.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Northern Ireland chefs Raymond McArdle, Chris McGowan and Will Brown prepare seafood courses, taking inspiration from their families' and communities' contributions to the war effort. The contenders are vying to win a place in the regional final to get the chance to cook at a banquet marking the 70th anniversary of D-Day.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond embarks on a big food-shopping trip, buying chicken thighs to prepare peach and whiskey chicken.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ladd is busy coaching at a football training camp, so Ree makes lunch for 120 hungry staff and children, whipping up a picnic of hot roast beef sandwiches.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Contestants compete to have their cake at an event for executive producers of The Simpsons, and walk out with the $10,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Kids BBQ Championship
programme.desc: The competition heats up with two rounds of head-to-head barbecue battles, and chef Kardea Brown joins the judging panel to help decide which young barbecue cook will be sent home.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels across America on a mission to highlight some of the nation's culinary treasures. He begins in Austin, Texas, where he uncovers sought-after and top-secret restaurants and dishes.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to Boston, where he sheds light on some lesser-known dishes and secret restaurants in a town well known for its food.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. The chef is surprised to discover how many of these plants can be eaten raw, but it does not stop him using them to prepare curried fritters and a hearty cannelloni.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef explains the value of pickling and preserving home-grown produce and explains why knowledge of these processes has been of vital importance throughout history. He goes on to demonstrate the procedure by pickling courgettes with mint and chilli, as well as aubergines with garlic and oregano.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking is in Southern California for two unbelievable backyard blowouts.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Nothing grabs Roger's attention like a raging wood-burning fire, as he witnesses a spectacular feast that everyone can dive into.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the villages surrounding Toulouse in the French Pyrenees, an area renowned for its artisan food. He goes truffle-hunting and prepares an omelette with the pickings, learns how to make bread in the traditional way, and joins locals for a wild boar hunt. The chef also shows how to prepare tarte Tatin, Roquefort salad, confit of duck and a country-style terrine.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps a pizzeria owner put an end to the family drama that is tearing his business apart and driving away customers.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A Californian restaurant owner becomes suspicious when there is a spike in coupon use, and asks the team to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The team helps the owner of Red Balls Rock-and Roll Pizza, Moorpark, California when his restaurant has a set of inventory discrepancies.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor endures a sleepless night - and naturally ensures the eternally put-upon Margaret and their neighbours share in his suffering. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Profile of Les Dawson, who was famed for his deadpan, world-weary comedy style and plentiful jokes about his wife and mother-in-law, illustrated by his numerous appearances on TV chat shows. Narrated by Dawn French.(n)

programme.title: We're Doomed! The Dad's Army Story
programme.desc: Comedy drama based on the story of how Jimmy Perry and David Croft brought the sitcom Dad's Army to life. Running from Perry's initial idea in 1967 until the transmission of the first episode in 1968, the film shows the beginnings of their writing partnership and the casting woes, personal clashes and production difficulties that put the show's existence in jeopardy. Starring Paul Ritter and Richard Dormer.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A weeping statue in the local church gives Del an idea for a money-making scheme to help a hospice under threat of closure. However, his efforts are thwarted by the weather. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Uncle Albert has a nasty fall into the cellar at the Nag's Head, but turns his injury into a profit-making opportunity - eagerly egged on by wheeler-dealer Del-Boy. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney aspires to be a pop star, taking on the role of the drumless drummer in Mental Mickey's band but, not surprisingly, Del-Boy manages to ruin his chances. With a guest appearance by DJ Mike Read, alongside David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Dodgy dealer Del gets his hands on a consignment of self-inflating rubber dolls, which turn out to be filled with explosive gas. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotter brothers are guests at a wedding, where they are intrigued to hear their dear departed mother inherited the ill-gotten gains of an East End bank robber - but nobody has ever found the loot. Christmas special of the long-running comedy, originally shown in 1987, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield, with a guest appearance by Joan Sims.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del enters one of Rodney's old paintings in a competition and is over the moon when he wins a holiday for three at a five-star hotel in Majorca. Soon after, the Trotter brothers and Cassandra arrive at Palma Airport - but Del-Boy reveals there is a slight snag. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney leaves home after a fight with Cassandra, and arranges a date with receptionist Tanya in an effort to make his wife jealous - but Del's interference ensures the plan fails to go as smoothly as it should. Christmas special first shown in 1990, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Uncle Albert has a nasty fall into the cellar at the Nag's Head, but turns his injury into a profit-making opportunity - eagerly egged on by wheeler-dealer Del-Boy. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney aspires to be a pop star, taking on the role of the drumless drummer in Mental Mickey's band but, not surprisingly, Del-Boy manages to ruin his chances. With a guest appearance by DJ Mike Read, alongside David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Dodgy dealer Del gets his hands on a consignment of self-inflating rubber dolls, which turn out to be filled with explosive gas. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del enters one of Rodney's old paintings in a competition and is over the moon when he wins a holiday for three at a five-star hotel in Majorca. Soon after, the Trotter brothers and Cassandra arrive at Palma Airport - but Del-Boy reveals there is a slight snag. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Gwyneth Strong.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: It seems that everyone in the Brown family has a date for Valentine's Day except Agnes, so she turns to the internet to find herself a man. Dermot tries to come up with a loving gesture to prove to Maria he can still be romantic - but he makes the mistake of taking advice from Buster - while Agnes and Winnie are fascinated by Betty's sex manual and Grandad ends up addicted to Viagra. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: A secretive phone call from a solicitor to Mrs Brown leaves her children suspecting one of them may be adopted, while Father Quinn returns from rehab and asks Agnes to help out at his annual garden party - although as she proceeds to drive him crazy with a smartphone, his recovery may be short-lived. Meanwhile, Cathy receives a blast from the past, Rory and Dino have a bust-up, and Mark and Betty deliver bad news - they are leaving for Australia right away. Domestic comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: The Browns are excited as preparations for Rory and Dino's big day are in full swing - although Agnes's mood is dampened when she meets flamboyant celebrity wedding planner La La Doggy. The foul-mouthed matriarch also clashes with Father Damien when he raises religious concerns about the ceremony - and to top it all off, she gets more than she bargained for when she invites Cathy's boyfriend's parents over for the evening. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll, with Jennifer Gibney, Rory Cowan and Conor Moloney.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary and Tony are horrified to learn Deborah is planning to sell up and travel around Asia, but their attempts to change her mind seem doomed to failure - until a smooth-talking estate agent arrives to value the flat. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Caroline Quentin.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary and Dorothy take a weekend break at a country hotel to spice up their love life, but receive a nasty surprise when they confess wild fantasies to each other. Meanwhile, Tony busies himself devising schemes to prevent estate agent Ray sleeping with Deborah.(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Siblings Hector and Tabitha live in a carefully refrigerated gothic mansion and seldom go out, but a special event means that a babysitter is required to look after their bedridden, elderly brother Andras. For Katy, the offer of £88 for an evening's work is too good to turn down. Starring Reece Shearsmith, Helen McCrory and Aimee-Ffion Edwards.(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: The return of the anthology of darkly comic tales in which each episode explores the goings-on behind a door marked No 9. On board the overnight service from Paris to Bourg St Maurice, a motley collection of passengers tries to get a quiet night's sleep as the train makes its way across France. But as the sleeping compartment fills up, the chances of that begin to look highly unlikely. Written by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with Julie Hesmondhalgh, Mark Benton and Jack Whitehall.(n)

programme.title: Brian Pern
programme.sub-title: The Life of Rock with Brian Pern: Birth of Rock.
programme.desc: The host (Simon Day) presents his guide to The Life of Rock from prehistoric man to the present day, in a spoof three-part chronology of some of the biggest moments in rock history. In the first episode, Pern examines rock music's prehistoric origins, tries to discover the world's smartest band, and recalls the time he dressed up as a crab.(n)

programme.title: Brian Pern
programme.sub-title: The Life of Rock with Brian Pern: Middle Age of Rock.
programme.desc: The host profiles a selection of rock stars who, like himself, applied their creative energies to acting, charity singles and protest songs. Plus, former Top of the Pops presenter Noel Edmonds reveals how Russians tried to take down the aircraft carrying Phil Collins from Wembley to Philadelphia during Live Aid in 1985. Spoof rock documentary, starring Simon Day.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Show
programme.desc: Falconhoof must think quickly when a caller asks him to do a spot of charity work. Elsewhere, Dee Dee tries to deal with a laughing cow, Limmy is infuriated by a dreadful joke, two secret agents do battle and a bingo caller takes advantage of his well-connected friends. Comedy sketches and animations, starring Brian Limond.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Show
programme.desc: Jacqueline meets her hero, but the encounter does not go smoothly. Elsewhere, Major Boo Boo struggles to control his urges, two new policemen discover the perks of their job, Falconhoof tackles a suspicious caller, and Limmy entertains viewers with a scary story. Comic sketches and animations, starring Brian Limond.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Raymond prepares to celebrate the Queen's birthday, completely oblivious to the fact that girlfriend Patricia is expecting something special for their 10th anniversary.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.sub-title: Every Clown Wants to Play Hamlet.
programme.desc: The local amateur dramatic society's production of Hamlet and a mysterious disappearance leads Timothy to suspect his mother has been romantically involved with his uncle.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel's peaceful weekend in the country is disrupted when they find the faithful Mrs Bale is not her usual cheerful self. To add to their woes, Lionel feels unwell - but a visit from a doctor with a strange bedside manner sheds light on their housekeeper's mood.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrew household echoes to the sound of laughter, as Margaret joins the local amateur dramatic society and Victor begins penning a sitcom script. However, his mother-in-law's bath-time accident and a run-in with British Telecom soon leave the curmudgeonly codger in no mood for jokes. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Second Husband and the Showgirls.
programme.desc: Tom and Smiler arrange an interesting blind date and Truly discovers his ex-wife's new husband is coming to town. Frank Thornton and Stephen Lewis star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Cupid's arrow targets Truly when a woman from his past returns with amorous intentions, so everyone lends a hand in liberating him. Frank Thornton, Peter Sallis and Brian Murphy star in the last episode to feature Thora Hird as Edie Pegden.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry wins a competition - but when the prize proves more trouble than it is worth, it spells disaster for him and everyone who helps him try to get rid of it. Mike Grady stars.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Sarah Millican hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to her own brand of humour, before introducing routines by camp comic Joe Lycett and award-winning funnyman Russell Kane.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy's American girlfriend puts his taboo-bashing beliefs to the test and Mark finds himself getting on well with Sophie, especially once he starts hacking into her e-mails. Starring David Mitchell, Robert Webb and Olivia Colman.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Dafydd has a big decision to make - stay at home as the only gay in the village, or travel to London and risk becoming one of the crowd. Florence agonises over whether to hang up her crinolines, Linda receives hassle from the students, and Mrs Emery has knee trouble - causing a stomach-churning consultation for the doctor. Imelda Staunton guest stars in a Christmas special from 2005.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef embarks on a culinary journey by sea and land to explore the Far East's most diverse food cultures. He begins in Cambodia, where tourists are beginning to return after the fall of the Khmer Rouge regime. As well as discovering the joys of freshly caught swimmer crabs with green peppercorns, he learns how to cook the country's most famous dish - fish amok - and samples lok lak, made with marinated beef. He also visits the Angkor Wat temple and joins a rice barge to travel down the Mekong River.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling down the Mekong River to Vietnam, where the local diet features an abundance of herbs, freshwater fish and flavoursome soups. As well as following in the footsteps of his hero Graham Greene in Saigon, he is reunited with a former employee in Hanoi to try out the capital city's street food, and samples the produce on offer at the night-time stalls in Bangkok, Thailand.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling to Thailand where he meets one of his heroes, David Thompson, who has devoted himself to understanding Thai cuisine. He also takes a train to Phuket to learn the art of hot and sour tom yum goong, and visits Melaka to explore the Nyonya-style cooking.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: As the hot weather arrives, wasps create problems for Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and the animals also give him cause for concern - Marge's calf Psycho refuses to let him anywhere near and is in need of treatment from the local animal healer.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall decides to enter the Vegetable Challenge Cup at the local horticultural show and seizes the opportunity to do a spot of spying on main rivals Derek Purchase and Roy Gunning, reigning champion in the Longest Bean category. He also meets mushroom expert John Wright in an attempt to unearth a summer truffle.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall decides to plant an orchard and sets off for a day's work picking apples at Charlton in Somerset before getting some expert advice from Robin Small. Meanwhile, two of the pigs are sent off to the abattoir and a panel of tasters arrive to help him rate his chickens.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall teams up with old rival Michael Michaud to capitalise on the huge profits to be made at the Borough Farmers' Market in London, before joining in the ancient Dorset game of pumpkin-fettling at a Hallowe'en party.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall's adventures in Dorset, as he moves on from River Cottage and buys a farm. With 44 acres to play with, he hatches an ambitious plan to sell his home-grown produce to the public - but the ramshackle state of the barns he has acquired makes him fear he has taken on more than he can handle.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall's problems multiply as he tries to get his restaurant up and running in just two weeks - despite it being filled with mud and dirt. With both a kitchen and dining room to be created out of the mess, he starts planning theme nights, starting with a Valentine's Day Special.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall builds a maternity room for sow Maggie, who is due to give birth. He also turns his hand to installing plumbing and lavatories, using a system of willow and reed beds for filtration, and tries to restore the popularity of purple broccoli with the help of locally produced cheese.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four of the eight chefs from the previous heat return to face a skills test in which they must each create a savoury sabayon sauce and use it to make a glaze for seafood. Michel Roux Jr then challenges them to prepare French pork pie stuffed with chestnuts and apple and served with a British salad cream, before the contenders prepare their own choice of dish to be judged by Michel and Monica Galetti, who pick three to advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their pie-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After serving up their signature dish for judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, they are faced with cooking six individual pork pies - a task that proves problematic for vegetarian Jason - and preparing a meringue. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The third quarter-final sees the four heat winners take on the fiendishly difficult palate test, recreating John Torode's Indian spiced potato galette on chickpeas, having only had a couple of minutes to taste the food and write down what they think the ingredients are. Can they identify all 12 herbs and spices in the recipe? They then cook a showstopping dish for the judges and food critic Tracey MacLeod, who tells them exactly what she thinks of their culinary efforts, before they find out who has made it through to the semi-finals and who will be hanging up their aprons.(n)

programme.title: Sweet Baby James
programme.desc: Chef James Martin offers a guide to desserts, returning to places from his culinary past to reveal the source of his best recipes. The quest begins with a `best of British' theme at Castle Howard, North Yorkshire, where he is inspired to reinvent quintessential puddings including spotted dick, junket, Sussex pond and lardy cake, with help from his assistant chef Will Torrent.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prepare a selection of extravagant British gourmet dishes, using high-quality ingredients including lobster, truffles, prime cuts of meat and expensive chocolate. The duo also explore the stories behind the recipes.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi's culinary journey concludes in Israel, the country he grew up in. He explores fresh produce in Tel Aviv, samples seafood with a twist and explores the popularity of hummus. Later, he prepares shakshuka, a Mediterranean dish where eggs are poached in a spicy sauce of tomatoes, onion and hot chilli peppers. Plus, he travels to a remote farm to obtain one of his favourite ingredients - pomegranate.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: The MasterChef judge reconnects with his homeland's culinary heritage by cooking up a selection of Aussie delights. In the first of a two-part episode filmed in Sydney, he enjoys scallop kebabs at a family barbecue.(n)

programme.title: The Other Side of the Door
programme.desc: An American family living in India are devastated when their young son is killed in an accident. The wife (Sarah Wayne Callies) soon performs a ritual at a Hindu temple that will let her speak to the dead, but her actions cause her family to be haunted by an otherworldly force. Jeremy Sisto, Logan Creran, Sofia Rosinsky, and Suchitra Pillai co-star. Directed by Johannes Roberts(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A mother and her daughter retreat to what they believe is a secure sanctuary during a brutal home invasion. Newly divorced Meg Altman (Jodie Foster) and her young daughter Sarah (Kristen Stewart) move into a New York brownstone equipped with a panic room; a hidden chamber built as a sanctuary in the event of unwanted "visitors," unaware of how soon they will need it. When their home is the target of a seamless late-night break-in, Meg and Sarah take a stand from the sanctuary of the panic room, playing a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with three intruders: Burnham (Forest Whitaker), Raoul (Dwight Yoakam) and Junior (Jared Leto), during a brutal home invasion(n)

programme.title: Lost & Found
programme.desc: Just how low will a guy sink in order to impress the woman of his dreams? How does stealing her dog sound? In Lost and Found, David Spade plays Dylan, who is about to open an new restaurant and has finally found the perfect apartment. The apartment just gets better when he meets his new neighbor, Lila (Sophie Marceau), a very beautiful women who has recently come to the United States from France. However, Lila has just gotten out of a bad relationship with René (Patrick Bruel), who doesn't want to leave her alone, so she has little interest in romance, preferring to devote herself to her cello and her dog Jack. One day, Jack runs away and Dylan finds him; when he returns the pooch to Lila, it's the first time she's been willing to speak in full sentences to him, though not for very long. Faster than you can say "That idea is so crazy it just might work!", Dylan decides to kidnap Jack; when Lila thinks the dog is lost, Dylan will generously volunteer to help look for him, which will give Dylan a chance to impress Lila when he's able to find Jack so quickly. Sure enough, Dylan swipes the dog, but from that point on the plan hardly goes the way he had hoped. Star David Spade also co-wrote the screenplay with J.B. Cook and Marc Meeks; the supporting cast includes Martin Sheen, Mitchell Whitfield, Artie Lang and Jon Lovitz(n)

programme.desc: 07-02-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: In 1970s Los Angeles, bumbling private eye Holland March (Ryan Gosling) and muscle-for-hire Jackson Healy (Russell Crowe) become unlikely partners when they find themselves both looking for a missing woman named Amelia (Margaret Qualley) following the death of a high-profile porn star. Amelia's ties to the deceased actress are unclear, but as other members of the porn industry turn up dead, March and Healy's investigation reveals a much bigger conspiracy than the duo could have ever anticipated. With the help of March's teenage daughter Holly (Angourie Rice), their sleuthing eventually unearths corruption within the federal government. Shane Black (Iron Man 3) directed and co-wrote this action buddy comedy, which co-stars Kim Basinger and Matt Bomer(n)

programme.desc: Dark Wings, Dark Words. Shae asks Tyrion for a favour; Sansa tries not to crack under pressure; Jaime finds a way to while away the hours; Arya has an encounter with the Brotherhood Without Banners(n)

programme.sub-title: And Now His Watch Has Ended
programme.desc: And Now His Watch Has Ended. Frayed nerves and empty stomachs test the mettle of a depleted Night's Watch at Craster's. Meanwhile, Margaery takes Joffrey out of his comfort zone, and gives Sansa a glimpse of the future; Arya meets the leader of the Brotherhood; Varys plots revenge on an old foe; Theon mournfully recalls his missteps; and Daenerys deftly orchestrates her exit from Astapor(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.sub-title: The Bear and the Maiden Fair

programme.title: Game of Thrones

Meanwhile, Tyrion makes his presence felt as the Hand of the King, though not necessarily to the satisfaction of others in the royal court; Gendry is shocked by Arya's revelation on the road north; and Davos seeks naval power from an old acquaintance, the pirate Salladhor Saan(n)

programme.title: The Good Guy
programme.desc: After executive producing the acclaimed documentary Manda Bala and the J.M. Coetzee adaptation Disgrace, Julio DePietro makes his feature debut as a writer-director with The Good Guy, a drama about ambitious young Wall Streeters fighting each other -- and sometimes their own decent nature -- to get ahead in the world. Our narrator, Tommy (Scott Porter of TV's Friday Night Lights), is young, clever, charming, and attractive. He's got a smart, pretty girlfriend, Beth (Alexis Bledel of Gilmore Girls), an urban conservationist. He's also very good at his investment broker job, impressing his ruthless, cynical boss, Cash (erstwhile "Brat Pack" member Andrew McCarthy). When a key member of Tommy's sales team suddenly leaves for a competitor, Tommy needs to fill his spot quickly, and takes a chance on the bumbling Daniel (Bryan Greenberg, Bride Wars), a former Marine and computer geek who seems a bit naïve about high finance and a bit nervous around women. Tommy takes Daniel under his wing, showing him how to dress, where to socialize, and how to charm attractive women. Their relationship is threatened when Daniel begins spending more time with Beth, joining her book club, and becoming her confidant. Tommy begins to question his decision to share his wisdom with Daniel, while Daniel is forced to decide what success really means to him, and where his loyalties lie. The Good Guy also stars Anna Chlumsky (In the Loop) and Aaron Yoo (Disturbia). The film had its world premiere at the 2009 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Legal Eagles
programme.desc: Courtroom oppositions turned into partners to defend a trippy murder suspect(n)

programme.title: I-Spy
programme.desc: Yet another classic television series from the 1960s gets a big-screen update in this action-comedy inspired by the Bill Cosby/Robert Culp vehicle I Spy. Alex Scott (Owen Wilson) is a federal intelligence agent who has been assigned to find a particularly expensive and valuable weapon which has gone missing: a special stealth fighter jet which can not only hide from radar, but also turn invisible to the human eye. Scott learns a rogue agent has sold the jet to Gundars (Malcolm McDowell), a powerful and unscrupulous underground arms dealer. After blowing his opportunity to catch Gundars in the act, Scott formulates a Plan B -- it seems Gundars is a rabid boxing fan, so in order to get inside his organization, Scott recruits Kelly Robinson (Eddie Murphy), a longtime middleweight champion whose ego nearly exceeds his talent in the ring. Robinson is excited by the prospect of a life of espionage, but Scott and Robinson's personalities are like oil and water, and matters are hardly helped by the efforts of less-than-helpful fellow agents Rachel (Famke Janssen) and Carlos (Gary Cole). This adaptation of I Spy was directed by a woman who starred in a memorable television series herself, former Hill Street Blues regular Betty Thomas, who has gone on to a successful career behind the camera(n)

programme.title: Wildcats
programme.desc: Molly McGrath, a former American football player - and divorced mother of two - has her hands full when she is put in charge of the football team at a rough inner-city school. Although knowledgeable, she's inexperienced and her job is made even more difficult by the hostile reception she gets. But she gradually wins the respect of her players and begins to shape a winning team. Featuring a cameo from rap artist LL Cool J(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg stars in Emile Ardolino's comedy thriller as Deloris Van Cartier, a lounge singer at a casino managed by her lover VInce LaRocca (Harvey Keitel). He's also a drugs baron and when she accidentally interrupts him in the process of rubbing out a stool pigeon, she has to run for her life. To keep her safe until LaRocca can be charged, the police arrange for her to become Sister Mary Clarence at a nunnery overseen by stern Mother Superior. But you can't keep a good singer down and Sister Mary has soon so successfully invigorated the choir with her musical talent that the church is packed - and there is even a call from Rome for a Papal performance. Unfortunately, thanks to an inside man in the police department, LaRocca learns of her whereabouts and sets out to prevent her testifying; can her new found friends, the nuns, protect her?(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: After a freak accident causes all the tapes in a video store to be erased, an employee and his pal decide to make their own no-budget re-creations of various movies. Jack Black and Mos Def star in this sweet and surreal fable from director Michel Gondry ("The Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind"). Danny Glover, Mia Farrow, Melonie Diaz, Sigourney Weaver(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: In Shawn Levy's romantic comedy, Ashton Kutcher and Brittany Murphy play Tom Leezak and Sarah McNerney, a chalk-and-cheese couple who fall in love and marry. Now, all they need for the union to work is to survive both families disapproval of the match, deal with the well-meaning friends who meddle too much and, on their honeymoon, suffer a selection of Europe's worst accommodation. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: Director: Peter Chelsom. A couple reunite years after the night they first met, fell in love, and separated, convinced that one day they'd end up together(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Docudrama about two young arms dealers who win a $300 million contract to supply weaponry to US forces in Afghanistan(n)

programme.desc: A CIA assassin asks a former high-school classmate, now an accountant, for his help in saving the world(n)

She moves in with the Littles, much to the chagrin of Snowbell, the family's feline curmudgeon. But Margalo is hiding a dark secret, and when she mysteriously vanishes, the unlikely duo of Stuart and Snowbell set out on a heart-pounding, hair-raising journey to find her and unlock the mystery.
