programme.title: The Order
programme.desc: Heath Ledger stars as a renegade Catholic priest who uncovers a dark secret in the Church while investigating the death of his mentor in this spine-tingling religious thriller. The script was written by director Brian Helgeland, who penned the Oscar-winning "L.A. Confidential." He also worked with Ledger and costars Shannyn Sossamon and Mark Addy in "A Knight's Tale." Benno Furmann, Peter Weller, Francesco Carnelutti(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: In Joel Schumacher's taut thriller, told in real time, cynical, smarmy PR man Stu Shepard picks up a ringing phone in a booth in a busy New York street to find a killer on the line. Armed with a high-powered sniper's rifle, the anonymous caller soon proves his prowess and presents Shepard with a choice: convince the police of his story before they shoot him or drop the phone and be shot. His only hope lies in self-abasement and facing up to the truths of his life(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: (2003) Sean Connery stars in this all-action adventure as Allan Quatermain, called out of retirement in Kenya to help the government avert a world war being fermented by master criminal The Phantom. Quatermain gathers together a top team, including Dorian Gray (Stuart Townsend), Captain Nemo (Naseeruddin Shah), Mina Harker (Peta Wilson) and The Invisible Man (Tony Curran), each with their spectacular skill. From Venice to the wastes of Mongolia, the team face perils and death in their desperate race against time. Stephen Norrington's fantasy, set in an alternative VIctorian world, is frantic fun-filled action from start to finish, with the witty script matching awesome special effects. Edited for violence(n)

programme.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
programme.desc: Brad Pitt stars as legendary Wild West outlaw Jesse James in Chopper director Andrew Dominik's cinematic rendering of the events that would eventually bring about the death of the man rumored be the "fastest gun in the West." An eager recruit into James' notorious gang, Robert Ford eventually grows jealous of the famed outlaw. When Robert and his brother Charlie sense an opportunity to kill James, their murderous action elevates their target to near mythical status. Casey Affleck stars as Robert Ford and Sam Shepard co-stars as Frank James -- Jesse's devoted sibling and partner in crime(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Chronicle of the seminal rap group N.W.A. and their 'hood-to-riches success, tracing their story from the mean streets of mid-'80s Compton to their triumphant battles against censorship(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren travel to England to work on an eerie case about an evil disturbance at a London council house(n)

programme.title: El Cantante
programme.desc: Pop icon Marc Anthony steps into the role of Salsa superstar Hector Lavoe in this biopic that follows the singer from his early career success as a Puerto Rican teen sensation to his later status as a New York City Latin idol while also documenting his ongoing struggle against drug and alcohol addiction. Actress and pop star Jennifer Lopez co-stars as Puchi; Lavoe's longtime muse and love interest(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: Romantic drama telling the story of a lovelorn woman who has all but given up trying to find Mr Right until she meets a mysterious and attractive real estate agent at a nightclub. However, she knows virtually nothing about him and embarks upon a road trip to find him again(n)

programme.title: Sleepers
programme.desc: When a misjudged prank against an old man goes disastrously wrong, four Hell's Kitchen youths are sentenced to a year in reform school in upstate New York. There, the friends are changed by brutal beatings and humiliating abuse from the very guards sworn to protect them. Years later, when two of the youths are charged with the murder of one of their old tormentors, the horrible events of their past are revived. But, with one of the four friends serving as prosecutor on the case, the real villains may finally be brought to justice(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: In 1960s South Carolina, a young white girl (Dakota Fanning) and her black caregiver (Jennifer Hudson) are taken in by an eccentric trio of sisters. Queen Latifah and Alicia Keys costar in this heartwarming adaptation of the best seller by Sue Monk Kidd. Sophie Okonedo, Paul Bettany. Written and directed by Gina Prince-Bythewood(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Chronicle of the seminal rap group N.W.A. and their 'hood-to-riches success, tracing their story from the mean streets of mid-'80s Compton to their triumphant battles against censorship(n)

programme.title: Within
programme.desc: A widower remarries and moves into a new home with his new wife and daughter, but it isn't long until their happiness is disturbed(n)

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Live: Runteldat
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence is one of America's top black comedians, spoken of in the same breath as the late Richard Pryor and Eddie Murphy when they were at the height of their stand-up powers, and he's also appeared in films including Big Momma's House and Bad Boys. But he's also suffered setbacks in his personal life, from being arrested with a loaded gun at an airport to being accused by his co-star in the TV show Martin of sexual harassment. In this outstanding film of his stand-up routine, he confronts his demons and those who demonise him, as well as veering off to his favourite subject: women, and how hard they are to live with. And 'rundletat' is short for 'run and tell that'(n)

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: In 1925, an enterprising pro football player convinces America's too-good-to-be-true college football hero to play for his team and keep the league from going under(n)

programme.title: Rails & Ties
programme.desc: Kevin Bacon and Marcia Gay Harden give powerful performances in this poignant tale of a train engineer who has to deal with a professional tragedy while trying to care for his cancer-stricken wife. Miles Heizer, Marin Hinkle, Eugene Byrd, Bonnie Root. Directed by Alison Eastwood(n)

programme.title: Kicks
programme.desc: A black 15-year-old finally gets his hands on a coveted pair of Air Jordan sneakers, only to see them stolen by a local thug. With the help of two of his friends, he decides to embark on an adventure through inner-city Oakland to retrieve them(n)

programme.title: The Children
programme.desc: A chilling malevolence afflicts a snowy New Year's house party in the country for two families with young children, unleashing emotional and physical violence that takes a terrifying toll(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Now You See Me 2'
programme.desc: A look at "Now You See Me 2," the 2016 sequel to the 2013 thriller that follows the Four Horsemen's return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul. The film stars Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo and Woody Harrelson, and is directed by Jon M. Chu(n)

programme.title: Boiler Room
programme.desc: A college dropout gets a job as a broker for a suburban investment firm, which puts him on the fast track to success, but the job might not be as legitimate as it sounds(n)

programme.title: Monday
programme.desc: A young drug dealer struggles with the moral implications of his work(n)

programme.title: Introducing the Dwights
programme.desc: An already-unstable household becomes a virtual battle zone when the son of a risqué comedienne and a has-been singer finds mom meddling in his love life in director Cherie Nowlan's dysfunctional romantic comedy. Twenty-one-year-old Tim Dwight (Khan Chittenden) comes from a peculiar family; his mother, Jean (Brenda Blethyn), is a bawdy stage comic renowned for her scatological sense of humor and his father, John (Frankie J. Holden), is a faded country-music star who now works as a low-rent security guard. While dad is busy trying to revive his flat-lined career, mom spends most of her time doting on Tim and his developmentally disabled brother, Mark (Richard Wilson). Upon meeting the beautiful Jill (Emma Booth), Tim believes his may have finally found the woman of his dreams. Unfortunately in Jean's eyes there is only room for one woman in Tim's life, and that woman is his mother. As Tim's relationship with Jill grows increasingly serious, the stage is set for a battle royal between the woman who once gave him life and the prospective mother of his future children(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: In this big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Jason Bourne emerges from seclusion to reenter the world of high-stakes espionage(n)

Laurence Fishburne is Smoke, president and ace rider of a biker club that engages in illegal street competitions. A young up-and-comer (Derek Luke) with a secret up his sleeve challenges Smoke to become king of the road and the race is on. Orlando Jones, Lisa Bonet, Vanessa Bell Calloway, Kid Rock(n)

programme.desc: Coming-of-age tale set in 1950s small-town America about a wealthy industrialist who sweet-talks a widow into giving him the patent for her late husband's invention. As an act of revenge, her son sets about seducing each of the fat cat's daughters. But his younger brother also has an eye on one of the sisters(n)

programme.title: Citizen U.S.A.: A 50 State Road Trip
programme.desc: Alexandra Pelosi's patriotic travelogue crisscrosses the U.S. to attend naturalization ceremonies in all 50 states and listens to recent immigrants from around the world explain their decision to become American citizens. The film is inspired by the naturalization process experienced by Pelosi's Dutch-born husband, Michiel Vos, and includes remarks by former secretaries of state Madeleine Albright and Henry Kissinger, commentator Arianna Huffington, and rock star Gene Simmons(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: Two bickering, elderly neighbours find that their rivalry heats up when an attractive woman moves in across the road. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: John Irving scripted this screen adaptation of his 1985 novel. Set during World War II, The Cider House Rules concerns Homer Wells (Tobey Maguire), an orphan who spent most of his childhood at the St. Cloud Orphanage in rural Maine, where he grew up under the strong but affectionate care of Dr. Wilbur Larch (Michael Caine). Larch has passed along his medical education to Homer, and the young man helps the doctor care for abandoned children and the newborn babies of unwed mothers; however, Homer refuses to assist Larch with the illegal abortions that he performs on the side; Homer has moral objections to abortion, while Larch believes in the rights of the individual and sees it as his duty to keep women in need away from dangerous incompetents. Wally Worthington (Paul Rudd), an air-force pilot, brings his girlfriend Candy (Charlize Theron) to St. Cloud for an abortion, and Homer decides to go with them when they leave, hoping to see the world; however, the three end up going no further than the state line, where Wally's mother (Kate Nelligan) runs an apple orchard and cider mill, and Candy's family traps lobsters. When Wally ships off to battle, Homer grows closer to Candy, and the two fall in love. But their idyllic life at the cider mill is interrupted when Rose Rose (Erykah Badu), a field worker at the orchard, becomes pregnant and her father, cider-house foreman Mr. Rose (Delroy Lindo), turns out to be the father of her unborn child. This news coupled with the death of Dr. Larch, forces Homer to take a long look at both his moral principles and his future. Rapper Heavy D appears in the supporting cast as Peaches(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: British comedian, actor and writer John Oliver looks at the biggest news stories, political developments and current events in America and around the world, in this refreshing new show that delivers breaking news on a weekly basis. Filmed in New York shortly before its US broadcast, Last Week Tonight with John Oliver will feature a variety of guests and air on Sky Atlantic less than 48 hours after it premieres on HBO(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: Matt Damon (The Bourne Identity), Ben Affleck (soon to be seen as Daredevil) and Robin Williams (Insomnia, One Hour Photo) star in Gus Van Sant's Oscar winning film, with Damon as Will Hunting, a school janitor who also happens to be a savant with a photographic memory and the ability to solve seemingly impossible math problems. 'Caught' at the blackboard by teacher Stellan Skarsgard at about the same time he faces problems with the police, Damon is offered a choice - prison or counselling with an equally stubborn therapist (Robin Williams). From their sessions comes the film's drama as Damon is forced to deal with the tensions between his blue collar present and his potential future(n)

programme.desc: Romantic drama telling the story of a lovelorn woman who has all but given up trying to find Mr Right until she meets a mysterious and attractive real estate agent at a nightclub. However, she knows virtually nothing about him and embarks upon a road trip to find him again(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Groundbreaking. In the Season 6 finale, Selina and her staff get ready for the long-awaited groundbreaking for her library; Amy seeks clarity on her role; and Jonah asks Dan, Ben and Kent for help(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Dan Savage; Richard A. Clarke; Dan Abrams; Katty Kay; Michael Steele
programme.desc: Dan Savage; Richard A. Clarke; Dan Abrams; Katty Kay; Michael Steele. Advice columnist Dan Savage; counter-terrorism expert Richard A. Clarke. The roundtable guests are legal analyst Dan Abrams, news anchor Katty Kay and political analyst Michael Steele(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: British comedian, actor and writer John Oliver looks at the biggest news stories, political developments and current events in America and around the world, in this refreshing new show that delivers breaking news on a weekly basis. Filmed in New York shortly before its US broadcast, Last Week Tonight with John Oliver will feature a variety of guests and air on Sky Atlantic less than 48 hours after it premieres on HBO(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: In this "super-antihero" movie directed by David Ayer (Fury), a team of incarcerated villains -- including Deadshot (Will Smith), Harley Quinn (Margot Robbie), El Diablo (Jay Hernandez), Killer Croc (Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje), Enchantress (Cara Delevingne), and Captain Boomerang (Jai Courtney) -- are recruited by the government for a dangerous mission in exchange for reduced sentences. Jared Leto makes a cameo appearance as the Joker. Joel Kinnaman and Viola Davis co-star. Based on the DC Comics series(n)

programme.title: Selena
programme.desc: Jennifer Lopez stars in this true story of Texas born singer Selena Quintanilla-Perez, who rose from cult status to becoming one of the biggest stars in Latin Music(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: Matt Damon (The Bourne Identity), Ben Affleck (soon to be seen as Daredevil) and Robin Williams (Insomnia, One Hour Photo) star in Gus Van Sant's Oscar winning film, with Damon as Will Hunting, a school janitor who also happens to be a savant with a photographic memory and the ability to solve seemingly impossible math problems. 'Caught' at the blackboard by teacher Stellan Skarsgard at about the same time he faces problems with the police, Damon is offered a choice - prison or counselling with an equally stubborn therapist (Robin Williams). From their sessions comes the film's drama as Damon is forced to deal with the tensions between his blue collar present and his potential future(n)

programme.title: 15 Minutes
programme.desc: An action drama centering on the media circus, 15 Minutes focuses on a New York homicide detective named Eddie Flemming (Robert De Niro), a famous figure known for his heroic on-the-job manner. A tabloid news anchor (Kelsey Grammer) attempts to get the scoop on Flemming's latest beat when a pair of Eastern European criminals (Karel Roden and Oleg Taktarov) find a way to manipulate the media by filming their exploits, which they believe they can sell to bloodthirsty journalists and make themselves rich. In the wake of a double murder, Flemming teams up with Jordy Warsaw (Edward Burns), an arson investigator assigned to help locate the murderous pair. Meanwhile, Flemming must contend with his news reporter girlfriend Nicolette (Melina Kanakaredes) as he and Jordy find themselves enveloped in a lurid series of events that threatens to jeopardize their safety. Kim Cattrall, Avery Brooks, and Vera Farmiga are also featured in the cast(n)

programme.title: Evil Dead II

Thanks to the foretelling skills of three mutants called Pre-cogs, the future can be predicted and the guilty ones are convicted before committing any offence. These three psychic beings are part of the elitist Pre-Crime unit, within the Department of Justice. For the time being, their predictions have never failed. No one works with more enthusiasm than its boss, John Anderton, who due to a tragic loss dedicates his life to this cutting-edge project. programme.title: House Hunters International

programme.title: Tiny Paradise
programme.desc: Tiny Jungle Paradise. A Denver couple are moving to their own personal paradise: Mexico. The couple look to connect with nature and live a more relaxed lifestyle in the jungles of Tulum. They're going tiny and have designed an amazing house with plenty of outdoor space(n)

programme.title: Tiny Paradise

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Unfinished Business. Retired police lieutenant Barney Kale (Pat Hingle) insists upon reopening a 10-year-old murder case which he had never been able to solve. Heading to the murder scene, a lakeside mountain resort, Kale gathers together all of the likely suspects--including Dr. Seth Hazlitt (William Windom), an old friend of Jessica Fletcher (Angela Lansbury). When a new murder occurs, it appears obvious that there is an hidden agenda related to the revived investigation--but whose agenda, and why?(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: One White Rose for Death. Angela Lansbury thwarts another cold-hearted killer. Jessica Fletcher finds herself in the unusual role of victim when she is kidnapped at a reception for the British prime minister and held hostage by a defecting spy(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Corned Beef and Carnage. Jessica finds herself in the middle of a case of industrial intrigue when her niece, a talented advertising executive, is involved in a grisly murder(n)

programme.title: Columbo

Missie (Cottrell) is pregnant, and it's time that her and husband Willie (Bartholomew) strike out on their own and begin life anew. programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Psychic. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: (1968) Charlton Heston plays astronaut George Taylor, who is caught in a time warp and lands on a planet where apes rule, gorillas act as the army and humans are considered a sub-species. Taylor's power of speech makes him the subject of curiosity and experimentation that could prove fatal, but he escapes with Nova (Linda Harrison) into the Forbidden Zone where, in one of cinema's most iconic moments, he confronts the true nature of the Planet of the Apes. With Roddy McDowall, Kim Hunter and Maurice Evans(n)

programme.title: Beneath the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Astronauts land on an Earth that is now run by apes after a nuclear holocaust has destroyed mankind and befriend certain simian scientists who are sympathetic to their plight. However, a coup is shaping up among the leadership of the apes, which could lead to substantial changes(n)

programme.title: Escape From the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: (Concluding "Planet of the Apes" series) "Beneath the Planet of the Apes" ended with the world being destroyed in 3955 AD by a series of nuclear explosions. However, three intelligent chimpanzees manage to escape, and travel backwards in space and time, splashing down off the coast of Southern California(n)

programme.title: Conquest of the Planet of the Apes

programme.title: Battle for the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Last of the Apes film series in which Caesar, the uneasy leader of the apes, struggles to build a decent Simian society. programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: Brutal sci-fi action thriller set in 2084, based on a Phillip K Dick short story. Doug Quaid has an ordinary life, although he dreams nightly of Mars - a planet he has never visited. Determined to find the meaning of these dreams, he visits Rekall Inc - a specialist in memory implants - intent on buying a memory trip to Mars. But the implant brings to the surface long-lost clues as to Quaid's true identity(n)

programme.title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines
programme.desc: The most advanced Terminator unit ever is sent to destroy humankind and ensure the triumph of the machines. A decade has passed since John Connor helped save humankind from mass destruction. Now 25, Connor lives "off the grid:" no home, credit cards, cell phone or job. No way he can be traced by Skynet, the highly developed network of machines that once tried to kill him and wage war on humanity. Until the appearance of the T-X, Skynet's most sophisticated killing machine yet. Now Connor's only hope is the Terminator, his mysterious former assassin. Together, they must triumph over the technologically superior T-X and forestall the looming threat of Judgment Day . . . or face the fall of civilization as we know it(n)

Later, Piers travels to meet Seath's parents in Summerfield, Florida, with their visceral anger standing in stark contrast to Amber's cool demeanour. programme.desc: Sgt Merton finds himself under pressure when teenagers commit serious offences in the area and must race to stop a planned `chicken run' with stolen cars. Starring Duncan Bell, Sarah Tansey and Aislin McGuckin.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Steve Crane takes an urgent phone call, and is shocked to discover Peter Pyke's warehouse has gone up in smoke. It soon emerges that the owner's wife had spent time behind bars for fraud, and her husband is reluctant to answer questions - leading Merton to suspect the blaze was deliberate. Meanwhile, Vernon moves into his new mansion, but has trouble keeping up with his well-to-do neighbours. Rural drama, starring James Carlton, Duncan Bell and Geoffrey Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica joins forces with a Russian detective to solve a case of art theft and murder at a book fair in Miami. Whodunit, guest starring David Ogden Stiers and Andrew Robinson.(n)

programme.sub-title: A Breath of French Air - Part Two.

programme.title: Bertie and Elizabeth
programme.desc: Docu-drama chronicling the marriage of Queen Elizabeth and George VI, from their first meeting in 1920 to the King's death in 1952, set against a backdrop of national events, from the abdication of George's elder brother to the Second World War. Starring Juliet Aubrey, James Wilby, Alan Bates, Eileen Atkins, Robert Hardy and Corin Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A crackdown on an organised crime racket leads Foyle and Milner to a shipyard owned by the Talbot brothers, a duo with dubious links to a communist agitator who has recently moved to the area. When an engineer is murdered just hours after working at the shipyard, the detectives desperately try to track down the killer and discover the truth surrounding the Talbots' shady business dealings. Peter Capaldi guest stars in the wartime drama, with Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: As the sole witness to a dying man's last words, Bobby Attfield is determined to solve the riddle they present, and forms an unlikely alliance with socialite Frankie Derwent and visiting family friend Miss Marple to help him on his quest. A trail of clues leads them to Castle Savage, where they uncover a hotbed of stifled emotion, treachery and deceit among its strange inhabitants. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast that includes Sean Biggerstaff, Samantha Bond, Richard Briers, Rafe Spall, Warren Clarke, Mark Williams, Georgia Moffett, Helen Lederer and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: The Booze Cruise
programme.desc: Five men set off on a shopping trip to a French hypermarket, determined to stock up on cheap champagne for a wedding, but a succession of disasters turns the journey into a nightmare. To make matters worse, cantankerous fellow traveller Maurice drives the Channel-hopping adventurers up the wall with his constant moaning, and the wives back home take full advantage of their husbands' absence. One-off comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Pearson, Brian Murphy and Mark Benton.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: An elderly woman is found dead in her flat after a break-in, leading Ronnie and Sam to suspect a burglary gone wrong. However, following a tip-off from the victim's grand-daughter Connie, the detectives' attention turns to live-in carer Cecile, who is promptly arrested. But the accused points the finger back at Connie, claiming she had been deliberately starving her grandmother. Who will the team believe? With Jan Francis, Daniel Casey and Ramon Tikaram.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Following the brutal murder of a gay man, Sam and Ronnie embark on a desperate mission to track down the victim's adoptive son, who has gone missing. The prime suspect soon emerges as the child's biological father - an alleged violent homophobe unable to stomach the idea of the youngster being brought up in a same-sex household - but was he acting alone? Guest starring Glynis Barber, with Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Hill investigates a series of mysterious deaths resembling the various martyrdoms of Christian saints and realises they are being instigated by a shadowy figure who presides over a sinister suicide cult. A local vicar seems the most likely suspect, but his own death rules him out of the investigation - and events culminate in a surprise revelation. Psychological thriller, starring Robson Green.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Hill's judgement is called into question by the press, which gleefully seizes on DNA evidence suggesting he may once have unwittingly helped secure the conviction of an innocent man. Finding himself the subject of a media witch-hunt, he experiences a crisis of confidence - which is exacerbated by Alex's decision that she can no longer permit him to work for the police.(n)

programme.title: May the Best House Win
programme.desc: The competition finishes in Cornwall, where Polperro resident Lee Gregory, sales rep Michelle Mills, artist Anthea Lay and metal specialist Tony Gosling score one another's properties. They open their doors to a home with a model village in the back garden, a country cottage, a 1930s semi-detached house and 17th-century townhouse, in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize. Narrated by Guy Porritt.(n)

programme.title: May the Best House Win
programme.desc: Four homeowners in the south-west Midlands invite one another to rate their properties, with a £1,000 prize awarded to the winner. Under scrutiny are a converted malthouse, a 200-year-old cottage, a 1930s semi-detached property with a special garden shed and an impressive Dallas-style new build. Narrated by Guy Porritt.(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Miss Jones falls for new guest Hilary, a budding playwright who sends Rigsby into fits of jealousy by offering her the starring role in his latest masterpiece. Classic comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter and guest Peter Bowles.(n)

programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Chrissy takes over Robin's poker game when he is rushed into hospital. Unfortunately, she does not fully understand the rules and puts the rent money at risk. Comedy, with Paula Wilcox and Richard O'Sullivan.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Steve does his bit for the community by taking a group of delinquents on an outdoor adventure course on the moors, but one of the lads falls and breaks his ankle, while another is wanted for stealing from a shop. Rural police drama, starring James Carlton and Geoffrey Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Chris's over-friendly manner puts his job in danger, and Stephen's first day back at school proves nerve-wracking. Peggy is summoned to Leeds to discuss a possible promotion.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Danny's career is put at risk when he is blamed for killing a rare black leopard with an overdose of anaesthetic. The animal's owner demands the Veterinary Institute investigates the incident, but the vet gains strong support from his friends and colleagues - especially Du Plessis, who sets out to prove Danny's innocence. Drama from the wilds of Africa, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Deon Stewardson, Dawn Steele and Cal Macaninch.(n)

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: The programme returns with Alan Titchmarsh and his team travelling to Walsall to surprise young widow Nina Perrin Seedhouse. Her husband Gareth died last year after battling cancer, so it's up to the green-fingered experts to finish the dream garden he was going to create for his family.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly man reports an unusual break-in, during which the uninvited visitor left a mysterious statue on the kitchen table. It soon emerges that it is just the first in a series of unexplained events, as a police phone box arrives and then disappears from his garden, cement is delivered to his house for no apparent reason and a fire is started in his garage. Noakes advises Steve to keep well away as it is not technically a police matter, but the officer decides to investigate further. Rural drama, starring Trevor Ray, Georgie Glen and James Carlton.(n)

Nurse Taylor's happiness about her future with Frankie is sensationally shattered as the extent of his dishonesty is revealed, while Matron is shocked to see a familiar face on the ward.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart

Meanwhile, Rowan hides a guilty secret about the incident that led to Danny's licence being revoked, and Caroline returns to the fold. Drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Olivia Scott-Taylor, Cal Macaninch and Hayley Mills.(n)

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Chrissy and Robin borrow Mr Roper's car to drive to Southampton for a football match. Comedy, with Richard O'Sullivan and Paula Wilcox.(n)

Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, Benedict Cumberbatch, David Haig, Sylvia Syms, Margo Stilley and Hugo Speer.(n)

programme.desc: Return of the detective drama starring Bradley Walsh. She's on the jury for the trial of a drug dealer and murderer who Ronnie has been trying to nail for years, and the threat to her points to jury tampering, so Jake and Kate have to take a dramatic approach to win the case. The problem is, they're up against a formidable defence barrister. Co-starring Ben Bailey Smith, Dominic Rowan and Georgia Taylor, with guests Helen Baxendale and Christopher Fulford.(n)

Aside from tracking down the bullet ant, so named because one sting feels like being shot, Steve also holds a bird-eating tarantula, and gets a rare sighting of the endangered giant river otter.(n)

programme.desc: A construction worker pays to have fake memories of a dream holiday implanted into his brain, but discovers his mind has already been tampered with - apparently to erase his true identity as a secret agent from a colony on Mars. He journeys to the planet in search of the truth, but is drawn into a conflict between the tyrannical ruler and a rebel faction. Paul Verhoeven's sci-fi thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Rachel Ticotin and Michael Ironside.(n)

programme.title: Total Recall

At first he has misgivings about accepting a case so far from home, but finally agrees, only to find his already strained family life suffering as a result. Tense legal drama, starring John Thaw and Lisa Harrow, with a guest appearance by Robert Glenister.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: A deranged woman holds a wounded Andrew and a heavily pregnant Clare at gunpoint, triggering a tense siege as armed police surround the Beeches. Gary Mavers and Fiona Gillies star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Outside Edge
programme.desc: The team turns out for another Saturday game. Comedy, starring Josie Lawrence, Timothy Spall, Robert Daws and Brenda Blethyn.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls asleep during a flight from Paris to London, while a female passenger is murdered by a poisoned dart, leaving few clues to the killer's identity. Poirot soon discovers she was a money-lender, which may provide a motive for the killing. The investigation is turned on its head, however, when the victim's illegitimate daughter comes forward to claim the inheritance. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with David Firth, Jenny Downham and John Bleasdale.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When the sleuth's dentist is found dead just minutes after he leaves his surgery, Chief Inspector Japp believes it to be suicide - but Poirot has reason to think otherwise and embarks on his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: The family faces the unwanted arrival of a domineering aunt, while Larry's girlfriend also pays a visit - giving the unwelcome relative an opportunity to voice her disapproval of the whole family. Sven makes an offer that helps Louisa cope with adversity and Margo falls in love - but Gerry is more concerned with his newly acquired owlets.(n)

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The village prepares for Nick and Teresa's wedding as the Battle of Britain draws to an end. Pat faces a big decision as Marek prepares to leave, but Bob intends to ruin her plans. Frances fights to clear her name following the closure of the factory, Alison wrestles with her conscience, and a chance encounter leaves Joyce with some unanswered questions. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Americans
programme.desc: Philip and Elizabeth tell Paige more about the family business, but pressing new questions arise when an operation takes an unexpected turn. Meanwhile, a sensitive package jeopardises Oleg's life back home.(n)

programme.title: Tutankhamun
programme.desc: Carter returns to the Valley of the Kings as the First World War draws to a close, hoping to complete his search for the lost tomb. Maggie also arrives in Egypt hoping to resume their relationship, but Carter finds himself smitten with Lord Carnarvon's daughter Evelyn. The excavation is threatened by a tide of Anti-British sentiment sweeping across Egypt, and Carter and Evelyn get caught up in a bombing. Meanwhile, Carnarvon is in financial difficulties, and cannot afford to fund Carter's seemingly hopeless search.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A murder at a remote cottage in Northumberland takes DCI Vera Stanhope back to a place full of childhood memories and reminds her of an unsolved case from earlier in her career. Delving into the local politics surrounding a controversial proposal to dig a quarry, she and her team find motives in the unlikeliest of places - until they realise that the truth could be hidden within the land itself. Detective drama, adapted from Ann Cleeves' novel The Crow Trap, guest starring Daniela Nardini (This Life) alongside Brenda Blethyn.(n)

programme.title: Jericho
programme.desc: Coates now has the reins of Jericho firmly in his grasp, but in a bid to protect the inhabitants from rogue traders, he makes fierce enemies - which threatens to have grave consequences. Martha's condition gets worse, leading to panic among the townsfolk as the fever spreads, while Annie struggles to get her daughter to a doctor. Charles and Isabella agree to put their troubled relationship behind them and focus on raising capital for the viaduct - only for a ghost from Charles's past to come knocking on his door. Period drama, starring Jessica Raine, Clarke Peters, Daniel Rigby, Jeany Spark and Amy James-Kelly.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories

The detectives believe he may be covering for his father out of loyalty, but an interview with the mother causes alarm and suggests a darker theory altogether. Drama, starring Jane Antrobus, Darren Day and Samantha Power.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp comes to the aid of two friends who want to move to East London, and are pooling their resources in the hope of getting a shared house together. Phil Spencer helps a local woman aiming to make an investment that will help her with her long-term goal of quitting her job and making a living as a yoga teacher.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Kent as they help two more couples on their property search. Kirstie is with Savannah and John, who are desperate to find their first home to buy in Maidstone, while Phil is with Londoners Matt and Tricia, who are looking for a home in the Kent countryside on a budget of £1.5million.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The East Midlands is the focus of this week's house-hunting, as Kirstie Allsopp joins Sam and Becky, who have a £100,000 budget and are looking for a house in Nottingham with a sizeable plot of land. Phil Spencer is with Nigel and Jane, who sold their home in Australia and moved back to the UK when Nigel was diagnosed with early onset dementia. But despite being back for months, they have struggled to find a property that lives up to expectations.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre-lover Claire Flatt hosts the first party in Ipswich, where one guest makes a big impression by arriving in a limousine. Claire prepares Thai fishcakes and Princess Jasmine rice, as well as her signature dish `chaos cake', in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Millwall fan Kerrie Pankhurst hosts the second dinner party in Ipswich, which she decides to give a football theme - but the mood turns sour when one of the guests insults her team. Kerrie's decision to serve scallops and chorizo as her starter also does not go down well with DJ Dave James.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Magician David J Marks hosts the third dinner party in Ipswich, and hopes to win over Kerrie Pankhurst after offending her the previous night. His salmon starter impresses all the diners except Dave James, who explains all the gruesome things he would rather do than eat the fish, so the host lightens the mood by showing off his ventriloquist dummies and laying on a magic show.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Dave James hosts the fourth dinner party from Ipswich and asks his guests to attend dressed as pop stars. Claire Flatt and Nicki Yucel are suspicious about his celebrity connections, and there is trouble when the diners discover Dave obtained help with the cooking.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Speed-dating expert Nikki Yucel hosts the final dinner party in Ipswich, and is determined to cultivate a romantic atmosphere. As the evening progresses, Kerrie Pankhurst reveals her feelings for another diner, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition gets underway at Springbank Guest House in Whaley Bridge, Derbyshire, where Susan Torkington offers her guests the chance to learn the art of cheerleading. However, the jovial atmosphere is ruined when three stray hairs leave her fuming by leaving time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The Old Dairy in Bishops Barton, Somerset, run by former IT consultant Liz Cannon, is the venue for the second day of the competition. The guests encounter a digging session, a big argument and a close encounter with a hot teapot.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Toll House B&B in Saffron Walden, Essex, which is owned by Laurie and Carole Poole, featuring a competitive art session and a disturbed night's sleep for some of the guests. However, the plentiful breakfast proves to be a winner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Maria Ettridge hosts the final visit at the Roebuck in Marchwood, Hampshire, where she hopes to entertain her guests with an afternoon lesson in woodland survival skills. However, things go downhill when they are unimpressed with their rooms and two of the contestants clash over dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the final time to discover what their guests chose to pay. Tempers flare as the payments are revealed, and the contestants take the chance to settle some scores.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Carpenter Wes Leaver hosts the first party in east Kent, hoping his science theme will be enough to win him the £1,000 prize at the end of the week. However, the 34-year-old faces competition from estate agent Alexandra Austin, beautician Emma Phillips, dog-lover Sally Parry and fancy-dress enthusiast Stephen Drew.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Alexandra Austen hosts the second party of the week in east Kent, hoping to impress her guests with pan-European cuisine. However, the meal gets off to a shaky start when Sally Parry is forced to confront her fear of beans, while Stephen Drew struggles with a goat's cheese parcel. Alexandra's decision to serve veal also proves controversial, and it soon becomes clear two of the guests are not enjoying each other's company.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beautician Emma Phillips hosts the third dinner party in east Kent. Her main course is described by one diner as a pet on a plate, and Alexandra Austin declares the menu to be rather odd. Meanwhile, Stephen Drew and Wes Leaver enjoy an impromptu beauty treatment together.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog-lover Sally Parry hosts the fourth dinner party in east Kent, hoping to impress her guests with a pink-themed night, including posh pink food and table decorations. However, Sally and Emma have a heated argument, Alex misbehaves and Wes falls asleep.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Flamboyant Stephen Drew hosts the final dinner party in east Kent, and has designed a menu that will allow him to spend time entertaining his guests. With an Absolutely Fabulous theme, a few of the diners are expecting a Mardi Gras vibe, but he has different ideas for the night - before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Florence and Nadine, two of Chester's Grevy's zebras, are about to give birth, but other animals are struggling to produce offspring, including Iblis the Asiatic lion. Meanwhile, warthog dad Magnum is feeling the pressure of parenting as two of his older children, Dobby and Neville, are becoming increasingly hard to control, and Magnum is losing his hair with the stress.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Clare Grogan guest stars as a feminist protest singer who visits Craggy Island and talks gormless Dougal into giving her the parochial house while Ted is out judging a local beauty contest. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The priest makes a valiant effort to give up cigarettes for Lent, inspired by a challenge from Dick Byrne, his opposite number over on Rugged Island, but soon finds he is not cut out for a life of self-denial. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan and Ardal O'Hanlon.(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Period drama telling the story of a Second World War nurse who is mysteriously transported back to 1743 Scotland as she travels back from the battlefields with her husband. In the opening episode, Claire Randall finds herself at the mercy of a British soldier before being kidnapped by a group of Highlanders whose ranks include an injured man named Jamie, Starring Caitriona Balfe, Gary Lewis and Tobias Menzies.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to the upmarket quarter of Hollywood to help the owner of failing health-food restaurant Sante La Brea. As well as struggling to control his disrespectful staff, the proprietor receives a surprise visit from the police at the height of dinner service.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and David O'Doherty compete against Jon Richardson and Natasia Demetriou. John Kearns joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Clare Grogan guest stars as a feminist protest singer who visits Craggy Island and talks gormless Dougal into giving her the parochial house while Ted is out judging a local beauty contest. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The priest makes a valiant effort to give up cigarettes for Lent, inspired by a challenge from Dick Byrne, his opposite number over on Rugged Island, but soon finds he is not cut out for a life of self-denial. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan and Ardal O'Hanlon.(n)

programme.title: Parenting for Idiots
programme.desc: Famous mums and dads share their parenting experiences, focusing on the importance of rules when raising children, from sticking to a routine to instilling discipline. Sally Phillips talks about behaviour charts, Frankie Boyle discusses appropriate viewing, Shappi Khorsandi describes the shame of public tantrums and Carrie Fisher criticises unrealistic TV families. There are also memories of the good old days of 1970s parents with Grace Dent, while comedian Paul Chowdhry is left in charge of a nine-year-old girl's birthday party. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: An extended edition of the irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr. Team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock are joined by Joe Wilkinson, Ellie Taylor, Natalie Cassidy and Gabby Logan.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Serial renovators Lynn and Kerry cannot decide between starting a new project in the Chelmsford area where they currently live, or building a snorkelling business in Majorca, Spain. Sara Damergi and Jasmine Harman try to help them make a decision as they view properties in both regions.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Owner Alfie Bubbles and former Brookside star Philip Olivier welcome guests to a Beatles-themed hotel - The Yellow Submarine - in Liverpool. However, one guest is unimpressed when she falls ill on a sea voyage, and breakfast turns into a comedy of errors.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Megan Edgcumbe and Dick Stanley host the latest round of the competition at Manor Lodge in Cornwall. Things get off to a good start when the guests find their rooms clean, but later the hostess reveals her upper-class background and a Cumberland sausage causes a stir at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: James and Judith Calderbank invite their fellow competitors to the rural Ashculme House in Devon for the third visit of the week, but the couple's back-to-basics approach does not go down well with all the guests. Workaholic Alfie worries that having no phone signal will affect his business, while competitive Megan and Dick relish finding dust in the outside building.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competitors have great expectations of Kevin Wainwright and partner David Little's Satis House in Suffolk, but the last visit of the week sees old resentments resurface as Megan and Dick eagerly point out faults in the hosts' presentation - including an oversight in their room and overly crispy bacon for breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Alfie and rival owner Megan engage in a debate about breakfasts and heating, while David and Kevin become a little emotional before the week's winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Teresa Lynch search for a property in the western Algarve, Portugal. With dramatically falling house prices, she hopes her budget of £120,000 will be enough to fulfil her lifelong dream of living on the country's coast.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Niel and Jean Soley find a holiday home that can also be used once they retire near Huelva in southern Spain. The couple have been dreaming of buying such a property for seven years and want enough space so that all their family can come to stay, and give the property expert a budget of £210,000 to work with.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit Northamptonshire to assess a Saxon skeleton discovered by surprised homeowners Morris and Pat Jones while digging a pond in their back garden. Phil Harding and the archaeological experts look for a forgotten graveyard.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team hunt for the remains of a Roman villa in Somerset unexpectedly discovered by a farmer who unearthed a decorative floor underneath his pigsties. During three days of searching, they uncover a field crammed full of beautiful mosaics.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend visit petrol-head Kim in Hampshire, the owner of an accident-damaged 1995 Nissan Skyline GT-R. The team take on the challenge of transforming her Japanese supercar into a street racer's dream.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel treats a Labrador that is both a guide for the blind and a seizure alert dog, and has become lame in both its front legs. Invasive surgery could mean that the dog's owner, Toni, is without her lifeline. Meanwhile, a couple hope that surgery will save their Rhodesian Ridgeback's leg from a cancerous tumour, and Fitzpatrick Referrals receptionist Natalie's Tibetan terrier becomes unwell.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A family rush their Chihuahua, Darcy, to the clinic after it is hit by a car. For 18-year-old TaJournee, who is autistic, the dog is a lifeline, and Noel must use pins, nuts and bolts to reconstruct the broken pieces of its crushed pelvis. Meanwhile, the vet finds himself in a tricky situation while performing replacement surgery on a seven-year-old spaniel with hip problems, and a Winchester Prison sniffer dog that is lame in both elbows is brought to the surgery.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: In 2010, architectural designer Lincoln Miles and artist Lisa Traxler found an uninspiring 1970s bungalow on a plot on the Isle of Wight surrounded by ancient woodland. As part of their renovation project, they added a three-storey `tower' extension and used a range of unconventional techniques and alternative materials. Two years later, Kevin McCloud returned to find out whether the couple's methods led to success.(n)

programme.title: China's Forgotten Emperor
programme.desc: Documentary about Wu Zetian, the only woman to become emperor of China. Wu Zetian ruled China in the last years of the seventh century, and has always had a reputation as a brutal tyrant. However, recent archaeological finds have shed new light on her reign, revealing a gifted politician who shaped her country into a military, economic and cultural superpower. The programme examines tombs, palaces and treasures from her dynasty that highlight her skills as a leader and also the violence of her regime.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Michelle, who's 54, is airlifted to St George's after being involved in a car crash with her husband Paul in Surrey. She was given a blood transfusion at the scene and doctors work quickly to get her to CT to ascertain the full extent of her injuries. Cameras also follow Derren, 41, who has fractured his ankle while trampolining with his 12-year-old daughter, Macie.(n)

programme.title: Kinky Britain
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the bizarre and highly lucrative business of bespoke online fetish video production, following British amateur film-makers making their fortunes catering to other people's fantasies.(n)

programme.title: Drain the Ocean
programme.desc: Below the surface of the Earth's oceans lies a mysterious and relatively unknown world. With a diversity of life that rivals the rainforest, the ocean is one of the world's largest ecosystems, but relatively little is known about what lives in its great depths. Drain the Ocean draws on the latest scientific knowledge and uses CGI animation to remove the water, revealing a landscape of unimaginable scale - with underwater mountain ranges long enough to stretch round the world one and a half times - and with tens of thousands of mud volcanoes and other features that are more dynamic than anything found on land(n)

programme.title: Wild Mississippi
programme.desc: Raging Waters. As spring breaks along the Mississippi, melting snow and ice create a flood of epic proportions. For fish, high water comes as a blessing, nourishing the banks with rich soils and allowing easy passage to breeding grounds. But others are not so lucky. The deluge washes beavers and birds out of their homes, leaving them vulnerable to a host of forest predators. And for those with newborns, the stakes are even higher(n)

programme.title: The Wild West
programme.desc: True Grit. Meet the much-feared grey wolves and the hugely- territorial grizzlies that live in the Rocky Mountains, an unforgiving place where only the strong survive(n)

programme.title: The Wild West
programme.desc: Gold Rush. Few legends are more significant in the American psyche than that of the Wild West. For the animals that populate the Pacific Coast, that mythic past remains a savage reality. The coast is the West's final frontier, and even today, the iconic figures of the Old West have their real life counterparts in the natural world: elephant seals settle their scores in blood, black and brown bears prospect for pink gold in the form of thousands of salmon, pioneer beavers are fired by a spirit of manifest destiny, and bobcats range the new world alone. This is the iconic West as it truly is, as Wild now as it was in the glory days of the cinematic past(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Examining animals on the hunt in deserts and grasslands, where prey has nowhere to hide - but neither do predators, making the element of surprise difficult to come by. Cheetahs use their unmatched speed to solve this problem, while lions have learned to use desert storms to conceal their approach and caracals are able to blend into the tall dry grass. The programme also features footage of bald eagles stalking snow geese, hot rod ants who rely on the sun to kill their food, and headlight beetles that lure termites to their death with an eerie glow.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple who want to relocate from Spain to the Shropshire countryside. Armed with £1million, they search for a property with five bedrooms, a large kitchen-diner and a library, as well as up to 30 acres of land for an organic smallholding.(n)

General manager Thomas Kochs takes any change very seriously and oversees every decision necessary - from new alarm clocks to a £10million renovation plan.(n)

programme.desc: Dorset-based Sunseeker has been hand-building customised boats for the world's super rich for the past 50 years. The film follows the build of their first £20million, 40-metre vessel, which has been ordered by an exacting customer who's taken advantage of the firm's `made-to-measure' service. Meanwhile, the London-based sales team works to fill orders during the all-important boat show season.(n)

programme.desc: Fry is shocked to realise he has become his own descendant after the Planet Express ship travels through time to Roswell in 1947, while Dr Zoidberg is captured by the military.(n)

programme.title: It's Me or the Dog
programme.sub-title: Penny and Fudge, Mouse, Blue, Cookie and Tabie.
programme.desc: Animal trainer Victoria Stilwell comes to the rescue of Karen Holder's family and friends, who have taken second place to her six manic dogs. The animals' incessant barking and bad behaviour has seen the household's visitors dwindle over the years, with Karen's son Shaun becoming the butt of his school friends' jokes because of the pet hairs covering his clothes.(n)

programme.title: It's Me or the Dog
programme.desc: Victoria Stilwell tries to discipline two tiny canines that attack anyone who comes near them, with the man of the house getting bitten every night as he attempts to get into bed. Pomeranian Teddy and Pekingese Prince Louis's terrible behaviour has left the owners fearing their pets may be in line for a visit from the local dog warden with an order for their destruction.(n)

programme.title: It's Me or the Dog

programme.title: Flying Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the world of the pterosaur, a flying creature that occupied the skies 200 million years ago. Visiting sites around the world, from the Dorset coast to New Mexico, he explains how the reptiles evolved to defy the forces of gravity, and examines the features of their anatomy that can still be seen in present-day descendents. He also discovers why they became extinct after dominating the skies for millions of years.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family

Julie Bowen stars in a novel episode filmed entirely on Apple devices, with Ty Burrell, Ed O'Neill and Sarah Hyland.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Claire shoot an advert to rival a competitor's catchy new campaign - but creative differences threaten to tear the father and daughter apart. Phil, Luke and Manny join forces to take down a Peeping Tom who has been using a drone to spy on a sunbathing Gloria, Cam worries about Lily's lack of singing skills ahead of a talent show, and Haley has a confession for Andy when he's rushed to hospital with appendicitis.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Haley takes Alex to a concert, where not only does she get her sister drunk, but she also inadvertently introduces her to a sleazy guy going by the name of Weasel. Dad Phil reluctantly accepts that he's no spring chicken after watching Luke outperform him at everything, and Gloria challenges Jay to give up cigars, which he accepts - if she agrees to stop watching her soap operas. programme.title: Stargate SG-1

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster continues his bug-eyed view of the world of creepy-crawlies, revealing how predators defuse the defences of their prey. Highlights include the cockroach wasp, busy preparing a tasty - and very live - treat for its young, the whirligig beetle, which employs a water-based radar system, and the jumping portia spider, which feeds on other arachnids.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A further selection of creepy-crawly close-ups, focusing on courtship in the bug world. Highlights include scorpions shaking their booty, the perfume-wearing nasonia wasp and the tropical cricket, for whom romance goes out of the window as it uses bribery to seal the deal with would-be partners. One potential partner to steer well clear of, however, is the praying mantis, the female of which is notorious for eating the male just after - or even during - mating. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A close-up view of sex, bug-style, as David Attenborough talks viewers through the different ways in which creepy-crawlies reproduce. Size matters for the minuscule male orb spider, creepily sneaking up on its intended and trying to mate without her noticing, while there's no rest for the lothario-like butterfly, which has plenty of notches on its proverbial bedpost. However, the harvestman spider has no use for sex at all, and reproduces by cloning itself.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough shifts the focus to bugs that prefer cooperation rather than conflict. They include burrowing cockroaches, the suitably named social spiders - which share a 30-metre web - the queen bee and her happy hive of workers, and green ants pulling together to build a nest.(n)

programme.title: Zoo

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

Meanwhile, Iris is on the hunt for headlines when she joins Central City Picture News, although she's not keen on the reporter she's been partnered with.(n)

However, Red has one condition - he will only speak to rookie profiler Liz, and nobody knows why he is so interested in her. Another chance to see the first episode of the drama, starring James Spader, Megan Boone, Diego Klattenhoff, Harry Lennix, Ryan Eggold and Parminder Nagra.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Pat Seddon considers selling up and visits a clairvoyant, while celebrity chef Mitch Tonks makes an appearance at Brixham's Crab Festival.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)

programme.title: House

programme.title: House
programme.desc: While off duty, House goes to the bookmaker's, where a woman collapses. The doctor treats her, but when she gets to hospital, he enlists Foreman and Cameron to help him diagnose the cause. They find a growth on her pancreas, suggesting she only has two months to live, but further investigations reveal her illness is faked, and her symptoms are self-inflicted. Guest starring Cynthia Nixon (Sex and the City).(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: House defends his billing practices in Baltimore, while Foreman and the team struggle to diagnose what is wrong with a writer who has lost the ability to use words correctly. The patient's failure to explain his illness in coherent sentences forces the doctors to seek advice from their boss - who makes discoveries of his own during a heart-to-heart chat with Stacy. Hugh Laurie and Sela Ward star.(n)

programme.title: The Putin Interviews

programme.title: Nurse Jackie

She cannot find solace at the hospital either, as new director Mike Cruz (Bobby Cannavale) makes a personnel change that takes everyone by surprise, while Ellie nurses a very personal secret. Featuring an appearance by Green Day's Billie Joe Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: Nurse Jackie
programme.desc: Life in rehab proves tougher than Jackie expected, and she is reluctant to co-operate with staff and her fellow patients. However, her counsellor Laura is determined to make a breakthrough. Back at All Saints, Dr Cruz begins his modernisation plans, and Coop is delighted by his big ideas - though Ellie is considerably less enthusiastic. Guest starring basketball player Carmelo Anthony.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: Storm City

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor tours the rooms, restaurants and bars where the rich and famous have lived, died and fallen in love, checking in to Bastille's L'Hotel in Paris where Oscar Wilde spent his last days. He travels to New York's Chelsea Hotel, where long-term residents included Mark Twain, Stanley Kubrick, Edith Piaf, Sid Vicious and Robert Mapplethorpe. Richard also heads to the Dorchester in London's Mayfair, where Britt Ekland shares her memories of meeting and falling for Peter Sellers there in 1964.(n)

Starring George Eads and Jorja Fox.(n)

programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Toby's old friend contacts him, ready to blow the whistle about his employer's violations of environmental laws, while Amy is given the task of convincing the president to threaten a veto on a foreign aid bill containing an anti-abortion proviso. Will puts a political face on the destruction and deaths resulting from the melting of an Alaskan glacier. US drama, guest starring Mary-Louise Parker.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Air Force One is forced to stay in the air for 24 hours when the crew suspect the landing gear to be faulty, and as tensions rise, the passengers and ground crew begin to wonder whether the plane has been sabotaged. Drama, starring Martin Sheen and Joshua Malina.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.sub-title: Are You Now or Have You Ever Been?.
programme.desc: Jack's unconventional methods result in the case against a child molester being thrown out of court - and to make matters worse, the Office of Professional Responsibility investigates the team to make sure it plays by the rules in future. Detective drama, starring Anthony LaPaglia.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Grissom, Catherine and Brass investigate the murder of a blackjack player killed following a big win. The man was a Ferrari-driving highroller who had already scooped $10,000 earlier that night in a pool game, but the team discovers he was an entertainment tycoon's assistant, only in Las Vegas for an all-expenses paid weekend funded by his wealthy boss.(n)

programme.desc: American talk show in which British comedian, actor and writer John Oliver presents a satirical look at the biggest news stories, political developments and pop culture events of the previous seven days. The topical series sees the former Daily Show reporter offer his distinct take on a variety of social, political and existential issues facing society.(n)

programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at an Immigration Removal Centre, where the UK Border Agency is preparing to implement a mass deportation aboard a specially chartered flight. Meanwhile, officers in London investigate the home of a Chinese takeaway owner, and Steve Hassler's final case before leaving for another job proves to be particularly difficult.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Cameras follow the work of staff at the British Commission in Lagos, Nigeria, and workers at a steakhouse in London's West End are interrogated.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: A Nigerian man presents a passport that officers believe to be forged. Meanwhile, a woman suffering from terminal cancer tries to gain entry to the UK and a criminal is apprehended in Calais.(n)

programme.title: Limitless
programme.desc: Brian is called in to help investigate the murder of a retired FBI agent and employs new Sherlock Holmes-style powers of deduction and calls on scenarios from Miami Vice as he enthusiastically helps agents Boyle and Harris hunt for the man who shot one of their own dead in a park. Meanwhile, Brian reconnects with an old flame after bumping into her on the subway, but quickly begins to worry that she is only interested in him when he is on NZT.(n)

programme.title: Limitless
programme.desc: Brian's loyalty to the FBI is tested when Morra's representative Sands asks him to steal national secrets held in a password-protected laptop, in a safe that can only be opened by Naz's fingerprints. He is also forced to sift through mountains of rubbish for proof that a defence contractor has been leaking plans to highly classified drone technology, and is sucked into a desperate quest to prove a man's innocence.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: With Emily Prentiss back on the team, the agents hunt down a serial killer hiding out in the woods before he can strike again.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents investigate the murders of two families, where in each instance one person has been left alive - and a startling link between the survivors may provide a motive.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The examination of a social worker's body reveals the killer kept hold of it for months before dumping it - and when more remains bearing similar hallmarks are found, it becomes clear the team is looking for a serial killer who continues a macabre relationship with his victims after death. Emily Deschanel and David Boreanaz star.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Last Shot at a Second Chance.
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a convict at a halfway house, although Brennan has more to worry about as she testifies at a hearing regarding her alleged assault of a suspect in a previous case. If found guilty, she might never work with the FBI again. Crime drama, starring Emily Deschanel and David Boreanaz.(n)

programme.title: Customs UK

programme.title: Customs UK
programme.desc: Customs officers at Bristol catch three passengers carrying 87kg of tobacco. Claiming the amount is for personal use they put up a fight when they learn they may not be allowed to keep it. The crew of the Searcher boards a yacht on the trail of drugs, and a sniffer dog picks up a scent at Gatwick that turns out to be cocaine. John Rand narrates.(n)
